Job_Title: Data and Technology Implementation Analyst - DEL or ATL
Job_Description:
Description
About this role
Business Overview
Data & Analytics Solutions (DAS) within Data Platform & Solutions(DP&S) pillar of Technology & Operations is responsible for data stewardship, technical configurations, day-to-day user support and overall client experience of Aladdin's Data and Analytics enterprise platform – a utility-grade data factory & service toolkit that meets the diverse needs of the Aladdin community. The team partners with operations, engineering and AI Labs to enable platform transformation, grow the enterprise data asset catalog, develop institutional data domain knowledge, enhance data quality intelligence, expand data solutions capabilities and implement new clients and businesses onto the platform. Through direct engagement and partnership with vendors and the business, the team helps ensure our DP&S organization continues to improve the client experience and business values in the evolving market while undergoing ground-breaking changes
Role Description
The Client Enablement Chapter (“CE”) is responsible for the technical configuraton required to onboard new clients to Aladdin’s Data & Analytics enterprise platform as well as facilitating updates to the operating environment for current users. The team interacts with partners to understand business process needs to design & build solutions that are scalable, repeatable and integrated with various data sources to meet enterprise-wide self-service needs.
The CE team is a growing function that consists of skilled business analysts that apply standard BA techniches – armed with knowledge of BlackRock's organization, process & technology – to complete a wide range of assignments. The team is seeking an implementation specialist to support the rapidly growing BlackRock & Aladdin client pipeline. You will apply your experience and in-depth understanding of Aladdin’s Data & Analytics platform capabilities to design and deliver innovative solutions to our clients. You will be responsible for the technical design, build and installation of our platform in close collaboration with partner teams such as BlackRock Solutions (BRS) and end users directly. You will also be encouraged to serve as a feedback loop with our partners in Data Operations Engineering (DOE) to continuously enrich analytic capabilities in order to deliver outstanding solutions for BlackRock and the Aladdin client community. The ideal candidate is someone who enjoys shifting challenges and ambiguous environments, thinks creatively, possesses the confidence to have an opinion, takes the initiative and thrives under scrutiny and tight deadlines.
Key Responsibilities
Own day-to-day configuration requirements of new and existing clients on our Data & Analytics Platform – includes things like plotting key breakthroughs, handling action items, coordinating with partner departments, etc.
Design and promote Analytic & Reporting solutions that are customizable to meet clients’ needs but are also deployed in Aladdin in an automated, scalable manner
Gain an in-depth knowledge of Aladdin functionality to ensure clients take full advantage of the suite of Aladdin capabilities.
Apply solid project management skills to all product responsibilities: set agenda, drive tone, provide direction to individual team members, oversee execution, and communicate out to partners
Skills
Ability to multi-task and manage cross-departmental projects in a fast-paced environment
Relentless desire for understanding how processes work. Creativity in solving unconventional problems, entrepreneurial drive to learn new skills and technologies
Strong critical thinking and demonstrable experience using technology to solve problems at scale
Outstanding academic achievement, degree in business, computer science, economics, finance, mathematics or other quantitative field of study.
Superior communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly
Programming experience in Java, Perl, or Python is a plus, but not required

Our benefits
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
Our hybrid work model
BlackRock’s current hybrid work model is designed to enable in-person connections and collaboration that is core to our culture, while supporting increased flexibility for all employees. In line with local health guidance and regulations, employees are required to work at least 3 days in the office each week, with the flexibility to work from home up to 2 days a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. The health, safety and well-being of our people will always be our top priorities; we will continue to monitor local conditions and health advisories in making decisions about our work environments.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

Main purpose of the Data Intelligence Analyst role:
The Data Intelligence Analyst plays a critical role in actively building, upgrading, and maintaining the data-centric nucleus of the Buying and Merchandising arm of REVOLVE headquarters.

The Data Intelligence Analyst’s primary objective is to support the Buying and Planning arm of the company in order to ensure that shrewd inventory purchasing, and manufacturing decisions are consistently being made day-in and day-out to keep fueling our aggressive top-line growth trajectory while continuing to push the limits of our bottom-line profitability.

Major Responsibilities:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Work alongside business stakeholders to deliver impactful solutions and processes for new organizational initiatives.
Develop, construct, test and maintain architectures; align architecture with business requirements.
Data Acquisition, Develop data set processes.
Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods. Prepare data for predictive and forecast modeling.
Conduct complex analysis, develop new business metrics (test and implement), and build models to uncover key learnings form data, leading to appropriate strategy recommendations.
Deliver ad-hoc/updates to key stakeholders based on analytics & data
Define and implement high level reports/KPI’s

Required Competencies:

Outstanding analytical skills, with deep knowledge and understanding of numerical and statistical methods.
High comfort level with SQL and python programming, ability to learn and adopt new technology with short turn-around time.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills to propose multiple solutions, properly weigh tradeoffs and ROI, identify the best path forward, and exercise good judgment to drive ahead.
Strong attention to detail, logical thinking, & results oriented

2+ years of quantitative analytical experience.
Bachelor's or Master's degree required
SQL experience, query optimization, Data extract
General understanding of python or other programming languages.
Ability to build, validate, and productionize models.

Preferred Qualifications:
5+ years of quantitative analytical experience
Statistical background preferred
Advanced SQL, Python, & Excel/VBA
Experience with Clickhouse & Catboost a plus
Experience with e-commerce and product analytics a plus

Job Description:
At Regions, the Risk Analyst performs advanced risk analyst duties as a first or second- line of defense function for the bank. This position will lead the coordination efforts with internal and external parties to conduct financial reporting, controls, policy and procedure documentation, governance activities, and regulatory compliance. Additionally, this position will develop and implement independent reporting and/or financial analysis to assist in the Risk team’s oversight role. This role will also lead improvement efforts and provide regular updates on various practices, reports, policies, and procedures within the department.

Primary Responsibilities
Serves as subject-matter expert and oversees day-to-day identification, measurement, mitigation, monitoring, and reporting
Designs, develops, and reports independent analyses that provide greater insight into risk exposures and mitigation efforts
Enhances team processes and updates policies and procedures to reflect improvements
Leads the team’s preparation and involvement in regulatory examinations, which may include the annual Federal Reserve stress tests, examinations, etc.
Remains well informed of regulatory and industry practices and alerts team of updates
Resolves a range of standard to complex problems and analyzes possible solutions using standard procedures
Works towards mastery of knowledge of the organization, processes, and customers
May serve on related committees and/or working groups
May perform financial stress testing simulations
Offers advice and guidance to junior analysts, assisting in the development of necessary skills and the promotion of continuous improvement initiatives

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Risk Management, or related field
Six (6) years of related experience
Advanced knowledge of fundamental risk theories, principles, and concepts

Skills and Competencies
Ability to learn additional systems as needed
Ability to research, analyze data, and derive facts
Ability to work in a team environment when applicable
Ability to work under limited guidance
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation

Prior experience in managing governing documentation (policies, standards, procedures) preferred.

JOB DESCRIPTION

The Associate IT Infrastructure Operations Analyst will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of production and pre-production batch/transaction processing to ensure all SLAs are met. This includes monitoring batch and system alerts and monitoring theses systems for efficiency, along with process testing often necessary to identify any potential bugs or problems; when the system is not working properly, these analysts may perform documented troubleshooting tasks to identify and resolve problems.

This position requires the incumbent to work on a 4x10 schedule. The work schedule will be 4 days per week 10 hours per day for a total of 40 hours. Days off can vary from week to week. The likely schedule for this role is Wednesday - Saturday, 2:00pm - 12:30am.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Consistently reviews the dashboard and alerts containing the status of all environmental, applications, online, current batch executions and any batch abends
Processes production batch requests, creates and updates daily batch turnover, and monitors batch processing via scheduling application
Monitors emails for alerts regarding abends, threshold issues, server alerts and batch questions / scheduling requests
Compares payment processing, billing, and multiple scheduling applications for accuracy
Coordinates triage calls with vendors, developers, Infrastructure, and other teams as needed
Monitors internal tracking site for pre-production requests, accepts requests, and updates progress until the request completes
Provides system and Tidal logs to support escalated triage requests
Accurately assesses production changes submitted from Applications Development to maintain system integrity and standards
Creates reports and analyzes data to identify solutions that meet business goals
Analyzes current processes and identifies existing or potential problems in order to discover new process improvement opportunities
Performs other duties as requested or assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Resides within a commutable distance to either Alpharetta, GA, Rancho Cordova, CA, or Mechanicsburg, PA.
Detail oriented and problem-solving capabilities
Thorough knowledge of industry best practice of system/software principles, procedures and methodologies
Ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks in fast paced, high pressure environments
Strong analytical and quantitative skills to resolve difficult problems
Partner with the business to identify, document and prioritize business requirements
Ability to prepare various forms of reports, correspondence and presentations using data visualization techniques
Work within various SDLC methodologies (waterfall, iterative, agile)
Ability to quickly extract and communicate key insights from complex data and details
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Outlook

About the Role:
As a data analyst in the Business Intelligence department, you will be responsible for developing meaningful financial and resource reports that drive corporate strategic decisions, monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), and support project management monitoring.
Serving as a data analyst, your day-to-day role will include partnering with other departments/teams to provide financial and operational analysis — to explain how actions impact results, to help track project progress, and to suggest process improvements.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of NYSTEC’s enterprise resource planning (ERP) system (Unanet).
Collaborate with the Finance team to provide reporting, data analysis, and general system support.
Create and coordinate the preparation of financial, operational, and management reports by working closely with the controller, managers and directors.
Retrieve and use data from the accounting system and other data sources to provide information on KPIs.
Develop, coordinate the distribution of, and maintain reporting templates to report financial and operational information.
Build, develop, and maintain data models, reporting systems, data automation systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support key business decisions.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing report procedures and systems to develop strategies for enhancing or leveraging those processes and systems.
Work directly with decision-makers and end users to understand, define, and document current and possible future reporting goals, needs, and requirements.
Responsible for mockup, development, implementation, and training of internal customers requesting reporting needs.
Collaborate with Unanet support team as needed.
Creatively solve problems, propose solutions with minimal direction and exercise a high degree of confidentiality along with business needs assessments.
Document processes related to standard reporting; prepare user manuals.
Continuously evaluate ways to streamline and improve Finance department processes.
About You:
Required Qualifications
Expert in Microsoft Excel (Refreshable Web Query [RWQ], advanced formulas, Power Query, etc.).
Previous experience documenting technical report requirements; designing reports for performance, data quality, and simplicity/maintainability; and articulating trade-offs, as appropriate.
Robust experience with reporting tools, software, and other applications, including but not limited to:
Retrieving, modeling, analyzing, summarizing, and visualizing data.
Determining the best data and reporting application.
Conceptualizing complex data flows and transformations.
Previous experience creatively solving problems, proposing solutions with minimal direction, and exercising a high degree of confidentiality along with business needs assessments.
Basic understanding of financial statements, including Income Statements, balance sheets, profit/loss statements and cash flow statements.
Education and Experience
A bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology/systems, finance/accounting, math/statistics, or similar discipline and three years of related experience. An equivalent combination of advanced education, training, and experience will be considered.
If you’re an effective communicator who enjoys working in complex and collaborative environments, using your critical thinking and research skills to develop solutions for clients, providing support to customers, and you have the required education, experience, and skills, we want to hear from you.

Job_Title: Data and Technology Implementation Analyst - DEL or ATL
Job_Description:
Description
About this role
Business Overview
Data & Analytics Solutions (DAS) within Data Platform & Solutions(DP&S) pillar of Technology & Operations is responsible for data stewardship, technical configurations, day-to-day user support and overall client experience of Aladdin's Data and Analytics enterprise platform – a utility-grade data factory & service toolkit that meets the diverse needs of the Aladdin community. The team partners with operations, engineering and AI Labs to enable platform transformation, grow the enterprise data asset catalog, develop institutional data domain knowledge, enhance data quality intelligence, expand data solutions capabilities and implement new clients and businesses onto the platform. Through direct engagement and partnership with vendors and the business, the team helps ensure our DP&S organization continues to improve the client experience and business values in the evolving market while undergoing ground-breaking changes
Role Description
The Client Enablement Chapter (“CE”) is responsible for the technical configuraton required to onboard new clients to Aladdin’s Data & Analytics enterprise platform as well as facilitating updates to the operating environment for current users. The team interacts with partners to understand business process needs to design & build solutions that are scalable, repeatable and integrated with various data sources to meet enterprise-wide self-service needs.
The CE team is a growing function that consists of skilled business analysts that apply standard BA techniches – armed with knowledge of BlackRock's organization, process & technology – to complete a wide range of assignments. The team is seeking an implementation specialist to support the rapidly growing BlackRock & Aladdin client pipeline. You will apply your experience and in-depth understanding of Aladdin’s Data & Analytics platform capabilities to design and deliver innovative solutions to our clients. You will be responsible for the technical design, build and installation of our platform in close collaboration with partner teams such as BlackRock Solutions (BRS) and end users directly. You will also be encouraged to serve as a feedback loop with our partners in Data Operations Engineering (DOE) to continuously enrich analytic capabilities in order to deliver outstanding solutions for BlackRock and the Aladdin client community. The ideal candidate is someone who enjoys shifting challenges and ambiguous environments, thinks creatively, possesses the confidence to have an opinion, takes the initiative and thrives under scrutiny and tight deadlines.
Key Responsibilities
Own day-to-day configuration requirements of new and existing clients on our Data & Analytics Platform – includes things like plotting key breakthroughs, handling action items, coordinating with partner departments, etc.
Design and promote Analytic & Reporting solutions that are customizable to meet clients’ needs but are also deployed in Aladdin in an automated, scalable manner
Gain an in-depth knowledge of Aladdin functionality to ensure clients take full advantage of the suite of Aladdin capabilities.
Apply solid project management skills to all product responsibilities: set agenda, drive tone, provide direction to individual team members, oversee execution, and communicate out to partners
Skills
Ability to multi-task and manage cross-departmental projects in a fast-paced environment
Relentless desire for understanding how processes work. Creativity in solving unconventional problems, entrepreneurial drive to learn new skills and technologies
Strong critical thinking and demonstrable experience using technology to solve problems at scale
Outstanding academic achievement, degree in business, computer science, economics, finance, mathematics or other quantitative field of study.
Superior communication and presentation skills with the ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly
Programming experience in Java, Perl, or Python is a plus, but not required
#EarlyCareers
Our benefits
To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.
Our hybrid work model
BlackRock’s current hybrid work model is designed to enable in-person connections and collaboration that is core to our culture, while supporting increased flexibility for all employees. In line with local health guidance and regulations, employees are required to work at least 3 days in the office each week, with the flexibility to work from home up to 2 days a week. Some business groups may require more time in the office due to their roles and responsibilities. The health, safety and well-being of our people will always be our top priorities; we will continue to monitor local conditions and health advisories in making decisions about our work environments.
About BlackRock
At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress.
This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive.

Responsibilities:

Involve in creating user stories and managing the requirements effectively.

Knowledge in Business Requirement Gathering, Business Process Workflow, and Modelling.
Good understanding of creating FRD, and SRS documents for system application development.
Capable of conducting GAP analysis and Cost/benefit analysis.

Company: North Carolina Department of Information Technology
Job_Description:
Looking to take the next step in your IT career?

We currently have an opening for an Data Analyst.

The position is designated Statutory Exempt and is exempt from the State Human Resources Act.

The Data Analyst works closely with State Agencies to understand their business needs, assists in development and/or recommendations where the use of data supports the evaluation of programs, improvement of services, financial transparency, compliance and safety. This position is a technical resource who fosters partnership and collaboration across government agencies to assist in data driven decisions.

Duties include, but are not limited, to:
Performing data analysis and develop analytic solutions
Facilitatiting Joint Application Design sessions
Performing User Acceptance Testing
Developing and maintaining functional and technical requirements for solutions
Managing projects and oversee application and analytic development

About the Organization
The N.C. Department of Information Technology (NCDIT) serves as the Technology Center for the State of NC. Services that NCDIT provides reach a client base of state and local government agencies, as well as schools, colleges and universities. NCDIT’s mission is to enable trusted business-driven solutions that meet the needs of North Carolinians. NCDIT provides technology services to state agencies and is charged with closing the digital divide by expanding availability of broadband services and promoting the adoption of affordable, high-speed internet.
As NCDIT’s services reach North Carolina residents from all backgrounds, we believe that a diverse workforce is our most valuable asset to recognize, understand and meet the IT needs of our constituents across the state. NCDIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity, equity and inclusion. Join a team that welcomes, values, respects and supports all members of our work community.
Our agency culture intentionally values diversity, equity and inclusion through the implementation of thoughtful, practical, innovative and data-driven strategies. We are an Employment First state, ensuring that people with disabilities have equal opportunities to succeed in the state government workplace (Executive Order 92). NCDIT supports recent executive orders to address pay equity for women (Executive Order 93), establish paid parental leave for birth, adoption, and foster care (Executive Order 95), and implement fair chance policies (Executive order 158).
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities / Competencies
Applicants must meet both the Education Requirements and ALL Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs) listed below in order to qualify. Qualified applicants must submit an application that CLEARLY REFLECTS work experience that demonstrates the following:

Experience in analytic model development and/or consulting in the data science domain
Knowledge of advanced business analysis skills and demonstrated experience in the use of data and its transformation into information
Demonstrated knowledge of SDLC project management methodology supporting application development
Extensive knowledge of system administration duties, system analysis and programming, relational databases, and business enterprise business systems
The following Management Preferences are not required, but applicants that possess these skills are preferred:
Experience and demonstrated knowledge of data as it relates to data management, governance, privacy and/or integration
Prior experience in the use of data analytics to support State, Local or Federal government business decisions or policy
Substantial knowledge of specific computer environments and a broad range of programming languages with the ability to learn emerging programming languages
Minimum Education and Experience Requirements
Bachelor's degree in computer science or an IT related field or related technical degree from an appropriately accredited institution and two years of experience in business application consulting or development
OR
Associate degree in computer science or an IT related field from an appropriately accredited institution and three years of experience in application consulting or development
OR
High School or General Educational Development (GED) diploma and six years of experience in business application consulting or development
OR
An equivalent combination of education and experience

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire
Salary: $80 - $115k/yr
Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.
Ideal Skills & Requirements:
· Proficiency working with HRIS, databases and reporting applications
· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
· Ability to work extended hours as necessary to fulfill time sensitive responsibilities
· Commitment to the office and firm
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $80,000.00 - $115,000.00 per year

3 years
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

Washington, DC: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Please provide the best email address and phone number to reach you at:
In addition to Workday, please list the types of HRIS software you have worked with before:

Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Human Resources: 4 years (Required)
Information Technology: 3 years (Required)
Business Analyst: 3 years (Required)
Workday: 1 year (Required)

Sustainability Data & Systems Analyst
Apply Later
Job ID
10046144
Location
Kissimmee, Florida, United States
Business
Disney Parks, Experiences and Products
Date posted
Apr. 10, 2023
Job Summary:
At The Walt Disney Company, we’re committed to supporting a healthier planet by implementing measurable actions as we operate and grow our business. We have an opportunity for you to develop analytics to help achieve our sustainability goals.
Reporting to the Senior Manager - Sustainability Strategy for Consumer Products, Games & Publishing, the Sustainability Data & Systems Analyst will develop and deploy key processes, systems, and tools to measure and report progress towards our product, packaging, materials, manufacturing and Green House Gas sustainability goals. You’ll work on the essential processes, systems, and tools that will equip The Walt Disney Company to unlock its next wave of short-term and long-term growth in products, while delivering against our sustainability goals.
You Will
On any given day, as a Sustainability Data & Systems Analyst you might:
Develop and deploy strategies to measure progress towards our sustainability goals.
Champion use of data through development of reports and tools for various partners
Build dashboards that visually demonstrate progress towards sustainability goals using tools like Tableau/PowerBI
Seek and adopt best practices in reporting, visualization and analysis: data integrity, design, analysis, validation, and documentation supporting the vertical business sustainability strategy
Provide Technical Leadership by extracting data for analysis, seek out answers related to business problem and look for opportunities to automate process related to our sustainability goals
Develop processes, systems and analysis to estimate the cost impacts of sustainability goals achievement, and to score products on sustainability metrics.
Maintain a strong awareness of the global merchandise business, including knowledge of licensed, vertical, and flexible business models.
Serve as day-to-day partner for sustainability KPI measurement, questions, or concerns across CPGP.
Provide line-of-sight to Senior Manager on daily business issues.
Collaborate multi-functionally to unlock areas of intersection / interdependency (“connect the dots”) as it relates to sustainability.
Build and cultivate collaborative partnerships across functions and departments within Disney Parks, Experiences and Products to identify business issues, risks, prioritize solutions, drive alignment & implement changes on behalf of CPGP.
Work with multi-functional project teams to deliver new business initiatives and/or evolve existing strategies.
Contribute to a culture that champions collaboration, creativity, and innovation while driving accountability to results.
You Will Have
Here’s what you’ll need to be successful at this job
3+ years of hands on experience with Business Insight (BI) applications and configuration, advanced data visualizations and BI development with a focus on analysis, design, and development of dashboards, reports, and data pipelines for a significant retail business in a related field
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Proven analytical and data visualization capabilities such as Tableau, Microstrategy, Power BI, Business Objects
Ability to tell the story in data, and simplify complex analytics into recommendations that are easily understood and executable
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with individuals and teams (both small and large, technical and non-technical)
Excellent organizational skills
Familiarity with working in—or with—large matrixed organizations
Teammate with track record for building strong working relationships
Ability to balance shifting priorities to manage and deliver complex projects on time
Preferred Education
Bachelor’s Degree
Additional Information
This position is located in Kissimmee, FL.
Benefits and Perks: Disney offers a rewards package to help you live your best life. This includes health and savings benefits, educational opportunities, and special extras that only Disney can provide. Learn more about our benefits and perks at https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

Position
The City of Lakeville is accepting applications for a Crime Analyst. This position will collect information from multiple sources and determines relevance of the data to the Lakeville Police Department. Utilizing sophisticated analytical and GIS software, the analyst detects trends and communicates intelligence to patrol, detectives, command staff to inform decision making processes. This information sharing will aid in crime prevention and suppression and will enhance the investigation process.

2023 starting salary range is $37.10 to $41.43.
2023 salary range is $37.10 - $46.27.
Major Areas of Accountability
Assists Investigation Division
Provide analytical, physical, and/or coordination assistance during major case investigations such as lead tracking, link construction, crime mapping, or other duties.
Assist in directing the investigation and prosecution of crimes by developing leads, locating witnesses and suspects and creating visual exhibits such as charts and timelines.
Compose and distribute crime and officer safety alerts
File search warrants
Assist with search warrants, recording and documentation
Compile Internet Crimes Against Children (ICAC) Stats and submit monthly performance measures
Predatory Offender Registration (POR)
2. Crime Analysis
Identify and track crime trends as an important component of community-oriented and proactive problem-solving policing.
Analyze crime trends, crime patterns and accident statistics using GIS mapping to identify and direct targeted enforcement activities in conjunction with department supervisors.
Manage the information flow from other agencies in an accurate, efficient and legal manner.
Analyze known offenders' methods of operation and establishes timelines to perform suspect/crime correlation in order to provide suspect leads and targets for surveillance or directed patrols.
Research, organize, compile and analyze data and information for assigned special projects.
3. Crime Reporting and Sharing
Gather and disseminate intelligence information.
Attend regular briefings or roll calls with Patrol, Investigations, Street Crimes and Command Staff personnel to gather and disseminate information on criminal activity using GIS or related mapping to identify and plan targeted enforcement activities. This may include conference calls inside or outside our agency.
Provide staff with real-time intelligence during critical incidents.
Create Lakeville-based information advisories to share timely information with department staff, community members, local businesses and public safety partners.
Provide statistical input to supervisors about the job productivity of employees to include the preparation of strategic assessments for use in budget projections and staffing levels and/or deployments.
Prepare monthly statistical analysis presentations and strategic assessments for use in budget projections and staffing deployments.
Communicate with the public, other City employees and outside law enforcement personnel to collect crime information.
4. Networking
Network with analysts and crime prevention specialists from other departments to promote information sharing.
Assist in providing analysis of information during multi-jurisdictional investigations.
Coordinate projects with regional agencies, City departments and other organizations.
5. Interoffice Support
Perform other duties as apparent or assigned, including collaborating with all divisions of the police department, as well as other agencies.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES
Knowledge of various law enforcement applications
Knowledge of crime pattern analysis techniques, including statistical, geospatial, victim-o-logical, and epidemiological research and practice.
Proven ability to work independently to prioritize work requests as well as establish and maintain positive working relationships.
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality and always project a positive public image of the City of Lakeville
The ability to perform work requiring a high degree of concentration and judgment in interpreting practices and procedures to solve problems
Ability to suggest alternative solutions to crime analysis problems.
Knowledge of Statistical program languages; and date processing methods, procedures, and equipment
and GIS mapping software.
Ability to work under urgent demands, priorities, and varied requests to meet frequent deadlines from police, elected officials, and community members.
Ability to explain complex ideas and criminological aspects of behavior clearly, to many different types of individuals.
Ability to learn new computer programs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. communicating tactfully and courteously, knowing when to ask for assistance.

Qualifications
A Bachelor’s degree in criminal justice, computer forensics geography, computer science/engineering or an equivalent degree or the equivalent of related work experience and training.
Knowledge of the principles, practices and techniques of planning and research.
Preferred experience or education in the use of geographic information systems.
Familiarity with the concepts of database construction and management as well as the ability to design and customize reports from databases for the end user.
Experience with current Windows operating systems and Internet protocols.

The City of Lakeville is an equal opportunity employer.

The City of Lakeville provides the following benefits:

PERA: Employees automatically become members of the Public Employees Retirement Association (PERA) when they begin public service. Contribution percentages (city and employee) are established by PERA.

MEDICAL INSURANCE:
Employees can choose between single, single plus children, single plus spouse, or family coverage. Two different plans are offered. If one of the high deductible plans are selected, the City contributes a designated amount into a VEBA/HRA account or HSA account.

DENTAL INSURANCE: The City provides dental care benefits. Employees can choose single, single plus one, or family coverage.

LIFE INSURANCE: Basic life insurance is provided with the option to purchase additional supplemental life insurance for self, spouse, or dependent children.

LONG-TERM DISABILITY INSURANCE: The City provides Long-term disability insurance.

PAID TIME OFF: Employees earn paid paid time off based on years of service.

HOLIDAYS: Employees earn eleven (11) holidays per calendar year.

FLEXIBLE SPENDING ACCOUNT: Employees who enroll in a flexible spending account are allowed to set aside pre-tax dollars to help pay for out-of-pocket expenses for both medical and dental expenses. In addition, pre-tax dollars can be set aside for dependent daycare.

DEFERRED COMPENSATION: Employees are able to designate and set aside a part of income on a tax-deferred basis.

Job_Title: Crocs Inc.: Sustainability Data & Materials Analyst
Job_Description:
A world leader in innovative, casual footwear, Crocs, Inc., is dedicated to the future of comfort. Our original and most famous style, the Classic Clog, is instantly recognized around the world — and for good reason: since 2002, we've sold more than 600 million pairs in over 90 countries! We achieved our status as a global leader in the casual footwear category by taking an inherently simple approach to uniting style, modern comfort, and value.
Every day, we make a choice to have an open mind and look on the bright and colorful side of life. We embrace and celebrate the uniqueness in everyone, inviting the world to Come As You Are!
The Sustainability Data and Materials Manager will implement sustainability projects ranging across sustainable packaging, materials, data collection and analysis, and key program management such as our engagement with Sustainable Apparel Coalition and the Higg Suite of tools for standardized measurement. This role will report to the Director, Sustainability Transformation as part of the broader Sustainability and ESG team. This person will contribute to the future of our Crocs and HEYDUDE sustainability efforts while gaining exposure to many facets of corporate sustainability and ESG.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
Lead and implement sophisticated and innovative sustainable packaging and material projects spanning functions and brands
Drive diligence in scaling and implementing identified solutions, and timely completion of projects from idea to fruition
Responsible for exploration of alternative materials, suppliers, leading sustainable packaging transition across the enterprise
Responsible for supporting sustainable materials exploration and implementation
Bring outside-in packaging leadership by supervising policy, compliance and emerging trends and regulations globally related to packaging design and disposal.
Support key partnerships in the packaging space which may include non-profit partners and current or potential vendors
Proactively research innovative approaches, technologies, processes, materials, and partnerships to drive innovation within sustainability
Support standard processes in reporting and data management enabling reporting and auditing of lead indicators
Maintain overall sustainability dashboards and results across the function
Support Business Case development for key sustainability projects and initiatives
Supports the integration of tools relevant to data management
Lead Crocs' Higg program, including roll out of Brand/Retailer Module (BRM), Facilities Environmental Module (FEM) and Facilities Social and Labor Modules (FSLM) completing all "data in" responsibilities and leading "insights out" efforts to support improvement plans and strategic integration
Lead Product LCA calculations using Higg Product Module and MSI
Establish strong collaborative relationships locally and globally across the company to drive impact, awareness, and adoption of sustainability initiatives
Promote a culture of sustainability within the organization

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent Experience
3+ years of dynamic work experience within sustainability tied to product development, product management, data analysis or business solutions
Experience in corporate sustainability and consumer products strongly preferred.
Ability to work independently under minimal guidance on several projects simultaneously while adhering to specific timeframes
Bold approach – highly adaptable, make decisions, act comfortably with risk and uncertainty, and take charge of their role and results
Ability to communicate difficult concepts with a focus on simplicity to garner support and consensus from others
Solution oriented-able to anticipate problems and develop timely solutions
Sophisticated skill at problem-solving and ability to think critically
Attention to detail and strong/clear data management
Strong cross-functional communication skills, able to effectively navigate corporate relationships
Strong IT skills
Domestic and international as required by business needs (<10% of the time)

Aristocrat Technologies is seeking a Data Analyst in Enterprise Quality (EQ) – Insights. As a Data Analyst within Insights, you will be part of a team that is responsible for enabling the acceleration of data capabilities within the organization. This role is responsible for developing data models, analyzing data, and developing reports/dashboards that provide information about the quality of products, services, and processes. In this role, you will be expected to work with cross-functional stakeholders, effectively use analytics tools and technologies, and present information in a clear and compelling format. You will also be working closely with the Enterprise Quality team on several projects and strategic initiatives.

This role is based in Las Vegas, Nevada.
What You'll Do
Understand business needs to gather, analyze, interpret, and communicate data that informs stakeholders at all levels to make data-informed decisions.
Develop data models by extracting and transforming data into usable format.
Conduct data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and correlations.
Design, develop, and enhance dashboards based on stakeholder needs and business requirements.
Deliver analytics reports to support ad-hoc analytics investigations and requests.
Collaborate with peers, leaders, and stakeholders to achieve project objectives.
Write scripts (SQL) to join, transform, and aggregate data.
Participate in Advanced Analytics projects for AI/ML.
Work closely with the key leaders within Enterprise Quality to support strategic initiatives and projects.
Identify and implement improvement opportunities.
What We're Looking For
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, statistical analysis, or business intelligence reporting.
Proven data analytics skill with a HIGH ATTENTION TO DETAIL with a result driven approach and commitment to continuous improvement.
Proven collaboration, teamwork, and communication skills at all levels within an organization.
Working experience in Python or R (or other programming languages) highly preferred.
Working experience in SQL highly preferred.
Advanced Power Bi and/or Tableau knowledge with working experience in DAX (PowerBI) preferred.
Experience in Casino Gaming industry is a plus.

Aristocrat is a world leader in gaming content and technology, and a top-tier publisher of free-to-play mobile games. The Associate IT Infrastructure Operations Analyst will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of production and pre-production batch/transaction processing to ensure all SLAs are met. This includes monitoring batch and system alerts and monitoring theses systems for efficiency, along with process testing often necessary to identify any potential bugs or problems; when the system is not working properly, these analysts may perform documented troubleshooting tasks to identify and resolve problems.

This position requires the incumbent to work on a 4x10 schedule. The work schedule will be 4 days per week 10 hours per day for a total of 40 hours. Days off can vary from week to week. The likely schedule for this role is Wednesday - Saturday, 2:00pm - 12:30am.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Consistently reviews the dashboard and alerts containing the status of all environmental, applications, online, current batch executions and any batch abends
Processes production batch requests, creates and updates daily batch turnover, and monitors batch processing via scheduling application
Monitors emails for alerts regarding abends, threshold issues, server alerts and batch questions / scheduling requests
Compares payment processing, billing, and multiple scheduling applications for accuracy
Coordinates triage calls with vendors, developers, Infrastructure, and other teams as needed
Monitors internal tracking site for pre-production requests, accepts requests, and updates progress until the request completes
Provides system and Tidal logs to support escalated triage requests
Accurately assesses production changes submitted from Applications Development to maintain system integrity and standards
Creates reports and analyzes data to identify solutions that meet business goals
Analyzes current processes and identifies existing or potential problems in order to discover new process improvement opportunities
Performs other duties as requested or assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Resides within a commutable distance to either Alpharetta, GA, Rancho Cordova, CA, or Mechanicsburg, PA.
Detail oriented and problem-solving capabilities
Thorough knowledge of industry best practice of system/software principles, procedures and methodologies
Ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks in fast paced, high pressure environments
Strong analytical and quantitative skills to resolve difficult problems
Partner with the business to identify, document and prioritize business requirements
Ability to prepare various forms of reports, correspondence and presentations using data visualization techniques
Work within various SDLC methodologies (waterfall, iterative, agile)
Ability to quickly extract and communicate key insights from complex data and details
Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, and Outlook

The Data Intelligence Analyst’s primary objective is to support the Buying and Planning arm of the company in order to ensure that shrewd inventory purchasing, and manufacturing decisions are consistently being made day-in and day-out to keep fueling our aggressive top-line growth trajectory while continuing to push the limits of our bottom-line profitability.

Major Responsibilities:

Work alongside business stakeholders to deliver impactful solutions and processes for new organizational initiatives.
Develop, construct, test and maintain architectures; align architecture with business requirements.
Data Acquisition, Develop data set processes.
Deploy sophisticated analytics programs, machine learning and statistical methods. Prepare data for predictive and forecast modeling.
Conduct complex analysis, develop new business metrics (test and implement), and build models to uncover key learnings form data, leading to appropriate strategy recommendations.
Deliver ad-hoc/updates to key stakeholders based on analytics & data
Define and implement high level reports/KPI’s

Outstanding analytical skills, with deep knowledge and understanding of numerical and statistical methods.
High comfort level with SQL and python programming, ability to learn and adopt new technology with short turn-around time.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills to propose multiple solutions, properly weigh tradeoffs and ROI, identify the best path forward, and exercise good judgment to drive ahead.
Strong attention to detail, logical thinking, & results oriented

Advanced SQL, Python, & Excel/VBA

Experience with e-commerce and product analytics a plus

Chevron is accepting online applications for the Employee Assistance Program- Data Analyst position through 04/28/2023 at 11:59 p.m.CST
This position is part of a global team of EAP, WorkLife and Substance Prevention advisors who manage global psychological, mental health and wellbeing services. Senior Data Analyst
Grainger
LAKE FOREST US-IL United States
About Grainger:
Grainger is a broad line distributor with operations in North America, Japan and the United Kingdom. We achieve our purpose, We Keep the World Working®, by serving more than 4.5 million customers with a wide range of products that keep their operations running and their people safe. Grainger also delivers services and solutions, such as technical support and inventory management, to save customers time and money. We're looking for passionate people who can move our company forward. Grainger, a Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For, is looking for a Senior Customer Information Data Analyst to help us use standardized research processes to enhance and deepen our understanding of our customer segments. Find your way with Grainger today.

Position Details:
Do you enjoy applying data to uncover insights into wide ranging and hard to answer questions about the customer? Would you welcome the challenge of leading projects and collaborating across business functions to drive differentiated customer data? In this impactful role, you will work with Customer Information Researchers, Process Engineers, Technology Developers, and Business Leaders to build projects that provide deeper knowledge through data about Grainger's customers. By making actionable customer information available, you will directly contribute to helping Grainger market, sell, and provide the best products and solutions to meet the needs of our more than 4.5 million customers worldwide.

You Will:
Lead industry segment data projects based on established processes and direct team members to drive outcomes against approved schedules
Promote project communication, present deliverables and obtain approval from partners with minimal guidance from leaders
Perform quantitative analysis using SQL or Python – find the relevant data, transform it into a useful format, and structure the results in a consumable way
Develop project schedules and identify enhancements to existing processes with a focus on maximizing team output and efficiency.
Must be comfortable rolling up sleeves and performing challenging technical research work and presenting the results while being a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the underlying processes.
Have an understanding of the US Maintenance, Repair and Operations (MRO) market. Have an intuition for the opportunity of specific customer segments and can generally recognize valuable customers

You Have:
5+ years post-undergraduate experience
Bachelor's degree is required, in a STEM field. Will consider someone with a non-technical degree who has compelling quantitative experience
Experience leading projects, managing a team against an approved schedule, and obtaining approval of deliverables from stakeholders
Experience in SQL coding across enterprise data warehouses (e.g., Teradata, Snowflake) and writing custom scripts in Python.

Skills and Abilities:
Statistics, data visualization and analysis skills using Excel/PowerBI intermediate proficiency required
SQL and Python expert proficiency required
Experience formally presenting analysis results, recommendations, and deliverables to stakeholders, leaders, and peers
Can structure presentations into a coherent narrative that creates understanding among stakeholders and leaders
Ability to generate clear, actionable, valuable outcomes from an ambiguous starting point
Ability to simplify complex problems and explain them in an easy-to-understand way using common language.

Rewards and Benefits:
With benefits starting day one, Grainger is committed to your safety, health and wellbeing. Our programs provide choice and flexibility to meet our team members' individual needs. Check out some of the rewards available to you at Grainger
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans
Paid time off (PTO) and 6 company holidays per year
Automatic 6% 401(k) company contribution each pay period
Employee discounts, parental leave, 3:1 match on donations and tuition reimbursement
A comprehensive set of emotional, financial, physical and social wellbeing programs

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace

Everside Health is a national on-site, near-site and virtual primary care provider on a mission to fix America’s broken healthcare delivery model. We are technology-driven and care-obsessed. Sr. Data Insights Analyst Overview: :
The Senior Data Insights Analyst is responsible for the development of reporting and insights offerings for ebbo, working cross-functionally across teams to deliver on those offerings. They provide end-to-end support for large data insights projects as well as ad hoc reporting & analysis.
Duties and Responsibilities of the Sr. Data Insights Analyst: :
Assist clients in KPI development and defining reporting requirements specific to their needs.
Translate client data needs to internal teams to ensure data needed for reporting is captured.
Advise and assist in A/B test design & implementation and provide test reporting/analysis.
Critically think about data in the business frame to identify errors and inconsistencies.
Mine data, derive insights, and turn insights into actionable business objectives.
Produce business cases to guide future decision-making, versus simply reflecting on past results.
Identify and capture incremental revenue opportunities.
Skills and Experience of the Sr. Data Insights Analyst : :
5+ years of data analysis experience.
2+ years experience with Marketing or Product A/B test design and post-test analysis.
Presentation / visualization development experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strategic thinking and insight development.
KPI development and measurement.
Multi-tasking with cross functional teams.
Proficiency with SQL, PowerPoint and Excel.
Experience with either Tableau, PowerBI or Qlik.

We are looking to fill a Senior Data Analyst position on our Operations team. Description:
The Real-Time Analyst position is responsible for being able to observe, interpret, and analyze data as well as market trends in order to make recommendations to improve operations in order to reduce overhead costs while improving the customer experience. They will need to understand the current workforce’s performance and the types of customer contacts being handled to improve operations through effective staffing decisions. They will prepare and manage staffing and scheduling to ensure there is a sufficient number of staff available to perform all required department tasks. Attention to detail will be key in assessing daily staffing levels which includes monitoring attendance and schedule adherence. Both scheduled and ad hoc periodic reporting both real-time and historical will be required. Real-time adherence management for the operational team will be of extreme importance in order to provide direction, guidelines, and performance updates to hit all service-level metrics. Analyzing schedule performance, forecast accuracy, and underlying assumptions as well as historical trends, and making continuous adjustments to forecasting, headcount planning, and scheduling process is necessary to be successful in this role.

Ability to gather and work with multiple datasets
Will be able to mine data for trends or discrepancies and make recommendations based on conclusions
Work with other stakeholders and departments by sharing conclusions and providing potential solutions on how to improve staffing
Superior attention to detail is essential while reviewing data trends, both real-time and historical, as well as underlying assumptions
Serve as the subject-matter expert on workforce optimization issues
Ensure that service level metrics are met; maintain the right headcount, and calculate the contact center capacity
Advanced communication ability, both verbally and in writing, as they will be expected to communicate with internal and external stakeholders at every professional level
Curious by nature with an irrepressible desire to understand and know why. Will independently research issues and use effective questioning to explain discrepancies or have further context
Provides metrics and performance feedback
Works on special or ongoing projects important to area/process improvement
Operate as an effective team member by supporting colleagues and contributing to the overall team and business objectives, delivery, and achievement
Undertake any other duties of a similar nature that the company reasonably requests to be performed that are within your abilities, expertise, and skills.

Must have excellent work habits, including a willingness to work the hours necessary to get the job done, especially when important deadlines cause greater than normal departmental pressures.
Proficient in problem-solving and analysis
Interpersonal skills: Effective verbal and written communication and the ability to work/collaborate effectively with others.
Ability to multitask in a rapidly evolving and fast-moving environment
Embraces technology solutions
Ability to maintain calm under pressure
Loves pets and talking about them!
Great team player

Ability to work independently with limited supervision
Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures, and instructions.
Conform with all safety rules and use all appropriate safety equipment.

1-year relevant experience

Job_Title: Detection & Investigation Analyst Lead - Data Loss Prevention - M-F 3-11pm EST
Job_Description:
Job Profile

Position Overview

At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. This position is primarily based in a location within PNC's footprint. Preferred locations are listed in this requisition. Responsibilities require time in the office or in a field on a regular basis. Some responsibilities can be performed remotely. Additional locations may be considered.

Shift Hours: M-F 3-11pm EST

Job Description

Reviews and investigates customer cases, reports and work for potential and actual loss. Minimizes fraud, Anti-Money Laundering and/or organizational risk. Performs early detection of suspicious activity. Controls and prevents losses. May lead the work of and/or train detection and investigation staff.
Researches and analyzes bank activities and reports to detect and prevent possible fraudulent and suspicious activities. Recommends disposition. Identifies gaps and control enhancements.
Uses defined research procedures to identify and resolve issues. Identifies trends and escalates as appropriate.
Follows standards and practices to mitigate fraud, Anti-Money Laundering and other risk exposure and loss. Shares best practices among the team and/or service partners.
Prepares and maintains appropriate documentation of analysis performed and coordinates with internal or external stakeholders as appropriate.

PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:
Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.
Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.

Competencies

Anti-money Laundering/Sanctions Policies and Procedures – Knowledge of and ability to prevent or report money laundering and Sanctions-related activities in banking and financial services industry.

Business Ethics – Knowledge of practices, behaviors, applicable laws, rules, and regulations governing proper business conduct; ability to demonstrate ethical behavior in diverse situations.

Business Process Improvement – Knowledge of and ability to use methods for identifying, evaluating, introducing and implementing more efficient approaches to performing business related activities.

Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.

Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

Fraud Detection and Prevention – Knowledge of and ability to utilize processes, tools, and techniques for detecting, addressing and preventing fraudulent situations.

Information Capture – Knowledge of the processes and the ability to identify, capture and document relevant business information in an auditable, organized, understandable and easily retrievable manner.

Operational Risk – Knowledge of policies and processes for operational risk management; ability to use tools, data, and best practices to identify, assess, and manage operational risk exposures.

Problem Solving – Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.

Standard Operating Procedures – Knowledge of and ability to design, implement and evaluate standard operating procedures affecting daily and strategic business operations in order to increase operational efficiency.

Work Experience

Roles at this level typically require a university / college degree with
Education

Bachelors (Required)

Additional Job Description

Benefits
PNC offers employees a comprehensive range of benefits to help meet your needs now and in the future. Depending on your eligibility, options for full-time employees include medical/prescription drug coverage (with a Health Savings Account feature); dental and vision options; employee and spouse/child life insurance; short- and long-term disability protection; maternity and parental leave; paid holidays, vacation days and occasional absence time; 401(k), pension and stock purchase plans; dependent care reimbursement account; back-up child/elder care; adoption assistance; educational assistance and a robust wellness program with financial incentives. To learn more about these and other programs, including benefits for part-time employees, visit pncbenefits.com > New to PNC.

The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call 877-968-7762 and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.

The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO):
PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

California Residents

Refer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

As a SQL Data Analyst at AccumTech you will join a team of analysts working on the front lines to support a sophisticated healthcare data integration system. You will use strong query writing and analytical skills to investigate data anomalies, determine the root cause of processing issues, and perform bulk database operations. You will work directly with customers and partners to become a subject matter expert on their processes, needs, and capabilities and collaborate with our internal software development, project, and operational teams to help design and implement system enhancements and features. As a data enthusiast, your passion for the quality, management and health of our data feeds will play a critical role in decisioning, system health, and performance. You will interface with members of both the Implementation and Software Development teams to drive collaborative solutions on project work. The ideal candidate will be motivated by dealing with complex problems in data and developing creative solutions.

AccumTech is a small, but growing, software service company that is consistently voted one of Crain’s Detroit Business Coolest Places to Work by our employees. Joining AccumTech will give you an opportunity to take on challenging projects in a fast-paced agile environment, take responsibility for the growth of your team, and play a key role in the success and growth of the company.

AccumTech was founded in 2014 by experts in data management, pharmacy benefits, healthcare consulting and federal health regulations to assist key stakeholders in the integration of claims data between different consumers. We are based in Ann Arbor, Michigan and offer a competitive benefits package that includes health benefits, a competitive salary, paid time off, a 401K with employer match, and flexible scheduling.

Responsibilities
Perform research and analysis on large back-end data sets using a combination of complex querying and proprietary tools
Identify patterns during investigations and determine paths to issue resolution.
Handle ad-hoc reporting requests from both internal teams and our customers
Interact within custom tools and back-end databases to load and investigate data sets.
Become a subject matter expert on customer requirements, data needs, and capabilities
Participate in the company’s agile development process, documenting requirements and interfacing with development team members

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree.
3+ years of experience using SQL to query and analyze large data sets.
Demonstrated problem-solving capability.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated capability to quickly learn custom software and business processes
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment and take on direct responsibility with a growing company.

AccumTech does not sponsor H1B Visas.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

The Opportunity
We are hiring a web analytics specialist for our team! This role is part of the Digital Experience, responsible for driving deeper customer analytics and insights for the Experience Cloud business on Business.Adobe.com. The team is responsible for deeper understanding of Adobe’s ability to deliver an efficient customer experience to attract, convert and retain Experience Cloud customers. The team measures all aspects of the web marketing strategy to ensure high conversion, retention, and engagement rates on the site. The web analytics specialist will be an excellent Adobe Analytics and Optimization analyst that excels in data storytelling.
On the DX Web Analytics team, we believe that effective analysis can only be done when the data flow is well understood, and we are looking to add a business analyst to the staff. Our digital experiences are getting more diverse as traditionally in person experiences are blended with digital experiences. This senior analyst will help with business requirements that shape how we use AEC tools to drive concrete insights and significant business optimizations.
The ideal candidate is most comfortable sitting in between business and technical teams. This person can work with business and design teams to understand what and how goals should be measured, in order to work with technical teams to set up a measurement and optimization framework. This person partners with Product Mangers, SEO, Paid Media teams, on business needs, insights and is laser passionate about improving our customers’ experiences. What you'll Do Analysis
Deliver insight and understanding of visitor and customer behavior on Business.Adobe.com and other digital experiences.
Synthesize Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, and other data sets to drive deeper understanding of customer journeys – Who, What, Why of customer coming to the website
Understand key business priorities and marketing goals for Business.Adobe.com; deliver insights to support sales and customer retention goals. Collaboration
Collaborate with other analytics and research teams to tell comprehensive stories about the who what and why of the business.
Drive next generation of report automation (Powering Databricks by using CJA, PowerBI, Workspace)
Tell excellent stories about customer insights and our team’s impact on the business.
Work closely with the web strategy team to roll insights into the business and build valuable personalized experiences.
Data consolidation, Cross-team collaboration and Storytelling are essential skills for this job. What you need to succeed
3-5+ years related work experience in online B2B environments.
BS in statistics, mathematics, economics or other quantitative field required.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $73,900 -- $167,100 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.

At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans. Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).

In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
