Overview

This position performs data analysis to identify factors that affect business profitability, growth, and efficiency. Assesses current practices, collects information and industry trends, and creates specifications to support business operations. Assists in determining improvements or solutions to address business issues. Prepares technical reports by examining and summarizing data.


Responsibilities
Data Analysis - Sources, compiles, and interprets data. Analyzes data for accuracy and efficiencies, effectively communicates analysis output.
Operational Support - Provides support for business unit by responding to inquiries, identifying issues, and working to improve standard practices. Assists in implementing recommended modifications and enhancements.
Identifying Objectives - Determines overall business needs through analysis and reporting. May identify strategies to achieve company and department goals, and assist in creating specifications, project plans, or other forms of documentation to communicate business initiatives to wider work group.
Reporting - Produces reports based on data analysis, industry trends, and process capabilities. Conveys patterns, problems, and areas of improvement.

Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree and 0 years of experience in Analytics, or Operations, or Support OR High School Diploma or GED and 4 years of experience in Analytics, or Operations, or Support

Job Description:

Perform analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods; validate analytical techniques employed by other analysts; acquire and compile structured and unstructured data and verify its quality, accuracy and reasonableness; prepare and deliver expert level visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement; engage with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions and goals; bring structure to business requests, translate requirements into an analytical project approach, and lead complex projects through completion; delegate tasks and provide tactical and strategic guidance to peers; serve as analytics expert on cross-functional teams for large strategic initiatives; develop, own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes; actively develop the analytics community by mentoring, coaching and connecting others with resources and training; participate and present during scheduled analytics seminars. Company operates on hybrid model with three days in office and work-from-home available two days.

Requirements:

Requires Master’s in Statistics, Mathematics, Business Analytics, or another closely related field and two years of experience in job offered or in IT positions including Senior Consultant and/or Senior Business Intelligence Analyst; or Bachelor’s and five years of experience. Background in education, training or experience must include SQL, Python, Tableau, Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Data Storytelling, internal consultation to determine stakeholder issues and provide expertise as data expert on the usefulness and limitations of the requested data and where applicable suggest an approach where requested data provided in a manner so as to enable better data backed decisions.

About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion Statement
Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
How We Work
Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst

Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects

· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project

· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned

THE POSITION
Are you ready to join the team that manages the Commonwealth's Automotive Fleet? This position is responsible for assisting in administering the Bureau’s FleetFocus M5 system which houses all historical and current details of the Commonwealth’s Automotive Fleet. Employee assists the M5 Division Manager with current and future M5 development projects, learns to analyze data and trends, troubleshoots, and gains independence as the technical point of contact for all M5 issues. Serves as a liaison between the Bureau of Vehicle Management and various state agencies on monthly commute usage entry issues.

DESCRIPTION OF WORK
The Business Analyst 1 gains independence in researching, troubleshooting, and resolving system problems, acts as first point of contact for day-to-day requests. This position conducts research, aides in implementation, tests system upgrades, and assists in evaluating, identifying, and reporting system upgrade problems.

You will be responsible for updating the Monthly Commute Usage Entry Tracking database. Activities include preparing monthly database for tracking the current month’s entries, purging last month’s data, importing this month’s data from prewritten Crystal Reports, running and distributing various reports to end consumers, tracking errors, and other activities related to tracking commute usage entry.

Interested in learning more? Additional details regarding this position can be found in the position description.

Data Analyst, Research Success
Truveta was formed and governed by US health systems with a shared vision of saving lives with data. Truveta now offers the world's first health data and analytics solution to study patient care and outcomes. Our mission is to enable researchers to find cures faster, empower every clinician to be an expert, and help families make the most informed decisions about their care. Achieving Truveta' s ambitious mission requires an incredible team of talented and inspired people with a special combination of health, software and big data experience who share our company values.
Truveta was born in the Pacific Northwest, but we have employees who live across the country. Our team enjoys the flexibility of a hybrid model and working from anywhere. In person attendance is required for two weeks during the year for Truveta Planning Weeks.
For overall team productivity, we optimize meeting hours in the pacific time zone. We avoid scheduling recurring meetings that start after 3pm PT, however, ad hoc meetings occur between 8am-6pm Pacific time.
Who We Need
Truveta is rapidly building a talented and diverse team to tackle complex health and technical challenges. Beyond core capabilities, we are seeking problem solvers, passionate and collaborative teammates, and those willing to roll up their sleeves while making a difference. If you are interested in the opportunity to pursue purposeful work, join a mission-driven team, and build a rewarding career while having fun, Truveta may be the perfect fit for you.
The Opportunity
This Data Analyst will report to our Director of Research Success on the Partner team. They will focus on supporting strategic engagements with its Life Sciences partners. Leveraging technical skillsets, they will deliver collateral that will be used by members of the team to demonstrate the value of Truveta to prospective customers and drive adoption of the Truveta Studio in the Life Sciences space. The Analyst will have a strong background in health care, real world data (RWD), and leveraging programming skills to analyze Real World Data.
Responsibilities:
Use technical skills and domain expertise to receive incoming customer requests and produce custom analyses and results
Scope research project for what will be required, ask questions to clarify details, conduct custom analyses in R or Python on EHR data, produce result outputs (tables and plots)
Collaborate closely with other Truveta teams to conduct investigations of data sources to demonstrate veracity to current customers
Deliver feedback to internal teams based on customer requests to inform Truveta's product roadmap
Required Skills:
BS in Computer Science, Data Analysis, or equivalent
3+ years of experience analyzing Electronic Health Record data or other Real World Data sources in healthcare
Advanced skills using Python or R to conduct data analysis
Knowledge of electronic health record or claims data for data analysis
Preferred Qualifications
These qualifications are preferred but not required, please do not let them from stop you from applying for this role. You will likely get the opportunity to learn how to do these more advanced analyses if you don't already have experience.
Statistics
Regression
Kaplan-Meier Analyses
Survival Analyses
SQL experience
Why Truveta?
Be a part of building something special. Now is the perfect time to join Truveta. We have strong, established leadership with decades of success. We are well-funded. We are building a culture that prioritizes people and their passions across personal, professional and everything in between. Join us as we build an amazing company together.
We Offer:
Interesting and meaningful work for every career stage
Great benefits package
Comprehensive benefits with strong medical, dental and vision insurance plans
401K plan
Professional development & training opportunities for continuous learning
Work/life autonomy via flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Generous parental leave
Regular team activities (virtual and in-person as soon as we are able)
The base pay for this position is $106,000 to $139,000. The pay range reflects the minimum and maximum target. Job Description

Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting client and HUB operations with a variety of data and analytical services. The incumbent will use complex data analytic techniques to aggregate data into meaningful and impactful visual representations to be provide to client contacts at planned intervals and to fulfill ad hoc requests. The incumbent will also be responsible for performing standard statistical analyses, presenting results, and developing thorough documentation of the programming and results. Assistance with presentations, reports, and manuscripts preparation will be required.

What you will do:
Collaborate with members of the operations leadership teams to understand business requirements, trends and expectations for analysis.
Produce ad-hoc reports under tight deadlines for various client requests.
Partner with IT staff to validate data attributes and to assure consistent integration across several data sources.
Build database queries and deliver reports and dashboards using tools such as Tableau, Looker, Salesforce, MS Excel.
Collaborate with the marketing and business development teams, as needed, to measure program effectiveness and track KPIs.
Manage projects and ensure that deadlines are met and remain consistent with stakeholder expectations.
Provide ongoing analytical and technical support of existing data sources, data integration, operational reports and dashboards.
Develop and maintain relevant documentation.
Collaborate with senior management on a strategic vision and roadmap for ConnectiveRx's operational data solutions.
Analyze ways internal business users leverage historical data to understand trends, answer questions, and create standardized report automation to reduce the need for ad hoc reporting requests.
Participate in design sessions for new systems and features to enhance business processes.
Monitor daily and weekly inbound and outbound data feed exchanges to ensure on-time delivery and complete and accurate data.
Diagnosis of inbound/outbound file issues through a documented quality control process.
What we will need from you:
Bachelor's degree in analytics, computer science, economics, mathematics, statistics, or a related field required.
2+ years’ experience in an analytics role, client facing preferred
Experience in analytics; querying, munging, and managing large data sets. Must understand the business question, design the analytics solution to answer that question, and explain the answer to the client.
Experience in the pharmaceutical industry or life sciences strongly preferred
Strong computer skills required, with knowledge in database-management systems such as Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle required.
Intermediate SQL writing skills required.
Experience building Dashboards and Reports with a Business Intelligence tool such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Looker required,
Strong written and oral communication skills, must be able to explain complex analytics to a non-technical audience
Passionate about using data to improve patient medication access and affordability
Strong organizational skills: ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Desire to work in an entrepreneurial environment, and take ownership of responsibilities
Ability to effectively use communication tools to work within a team that is not all located in the same office
Mindset to continuously learn and develop
Why work with us?
Excellent company culture, fun events, and volunteer opportunities
Competitive benefits (medical, dental, vision & more)
401k package with dollar-for-dollar match-up
Generous PTO and paid holidays days offered
Opportunities to grow professionally and personally
Team-oriented atmosphere

GENERAL SUMMARY:
The data analyst serves as the statistical expert and analyst to support reporting throughout the department. The data analyst assists with department data and reporting needs including data entry, report creation, database management, and analysis. The data analyst generates administrative, financial, and operational reports as needed and requested. Additionally, the data analysts help to support the information technology needs of the department including system support, user training, troubleshooting, and problem resolution. The data analyst prepares and creates reports for executive level presentation. The data analyst oversees and manages the block boarding process within the operating room and maintains strong relationships with physician offices. Familiarity with Microsoft Office and the electronic medical record Epic are requirements of the job. A successful data analyst should be process and procedure driven and have excellent communication skills. The data analyst must be highly organized and have ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities. The data analyst must have exceptional customer services skills and a proactive attitude with strong attention to detail.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

1. Develops, creates, runs and compiles statistical, administrative, financial, and operational reports and provides data analysis as needed to support perioperative services.
2. Maintains system database, ensure data integrity, provides user training and support and assists department with system use and interaction.
3. Supports the IT needs of the department.
4. Oversees and manages the surgical block boarding process.
5. Demonstrates the delivery of exceptional internal and external customer service behaviors in every aspect of the job and (100%).
This document represents the major duties, responsibilities, and authorities of this job, and is not intended to be a complete list of all tasks and functions. It should be understood, therefore, that incumbents may be asked to perform job-related duties beyond those explicitly described.

Computer science courses.
Associate’s Degree preferred.

1 year experience in data maintenance (hardware and software).

C. Certification, Licensure, Registration:
None

D. Other Qualifications:
Knowledge of computer hardware and software applications (databases, spreadsheets, report writing).
Excellent quantitative, analytical and organizational skills.
Professional interpersonal communication skills.
Ability to prioritize workload.
Superior customer service skills.
Maintain confidentiality of patient information.
Ability to work in a stressful and fast paced environment.
Ability to adapt to change.

Were a strategy, identity and campaigning agency. At Shine we believe that mission-driven businesses can positively impact society and the world around them, while at the same time growing their organisation. It is our expertise and our job to help them do that.
Shine is a collection of creatives, strategists, designers, and business experts. And did you know were always looking to meet new people? So dont hesitate to get in touch if this role sounds like you!
The role:
Are you looking to kick-start your career in the business intelligence and data analytics sector? We are searching for someone that will want to own the technical design, development and delivery of business intelligence systems, reports and analysis for a growing division in Chicago. If this sounds like you, we have an excellent career growth opportunity for a graduate to join our team in our Chicago office.
We will count on you to:
Assist in the collection, collation, analysis and reporting of data.
Providing key statistics to the business to assist in the measurement of results, identifying trends and/or patterns etc.
Report Generation using Microsoft Power BI and Microsoft Excel.
Create unique solutions to business problems using data available internally or sourcing data from external sources.
Use data to support and influence critical business decisions.
Work with internal teams to generate regular and ad-hoc reports that can help them with their decision making.
Create and manage automated reports.

Have strong problem-solving skills and solution orientated.
Have excellent attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills.
Confident liaising with various business stakeholders.

Be motivated through achieving results.
Thrive working as part of a team in a challenging and demanding environment.
Passionate about data, analytics and problem solving.
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (Pivot table, vlookup etc.)

Job Description:
Job Description
The Data Analyst will support the Client Analytics and Client Management team to provide analytical support to client account teams. The Data Analyst will apply their knowledge of data analytics, research, and critical thinking to turn information into insights and recommended optimal solutions, empowering internal and external stakeholders to make data-driven fleet decision.
Essential Job Functions
Conduct fleet analyses and provide accurate, timely interpretations of vehicle cost, use patterns and trends that aid in the drive for optimal fleet
Work independently and with stakeholders to define ad hoc analyses and develop simple modeling tools and repeatable business process
Use visual data exploration and business intelligence tools to turn information into insights and recommend optimal solutions leading to operational efficiency at the lowest cost to our clients.
Utilize analytical, technical, time management and organization skills to help account teams communicate professionally, effectively and efficiently with clients and prospects using a full suite of internal tools and 3rd party software
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to help shape the strategic direction of the fleet by defining and tracking actionable initiatives that maximize savings, compliance, safety, and other defined goals.
Conduct strategic fleet analyses and provide accurate, timely interpretations of vehicle cost, use patterns and trends that focus on running and optimal fleet.
Leverage strong communication, data visualization, and presentation skills to deliver findings of analysis and explain complex statistical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Partner with the Business Intelligence team to design, test, and implement tools and models
Develop a working understanding of the Wheels Donlen tools and databases and how to access data, fleet metrics, fleet reports
Provide customized, business-focused consulting and fleet management strategy assistance to clients
Analyze large and multiple data sets using visual data exploration tools, and make recommendations based on insights, trends and exceptions gleaned from exploration
Additional Qualifications
Education Requirements: Bachelors Required; Preferences towards concentration in Finance, Computer Science, Business Administration, or an Analytical concentration
Work Experience: 1-3 years’ work experience with background in Finance/FP&A, Management Consulting, Computer Science, or Account Management
Role will be customer-facing, so strong presentation skills are required

About Loftware
Loftware is the world’s largest cloud-based Enterprise Labeling and Artwork Management provider, offering an end-to-end labeling solution platform for companies of all sizes. Maintaining a global presence with offices in US, UK, Germany, Slovenia, China, and Singapore, Loftware boasts over 35 years of expertise in solving labeling challenges. We help companies improve accuracy, traceability and compliance while improving the quality, speed, and efficiency of their labeling. As the leading global provider of Enterprise Labeling and Artwork Management solutions, Loftware enables supply chain agility, supports evolving regulations, and optimizes business operations for a wide range of industries including automotive, chemicals, consumer products, electronics, food & beverage, manufacturing, medical device, pharmaceuticals, retail and apparel.
Job Description
As our Sr. Data Analyst, you will be responsible for managing and owning data in our Salesforce environment. You will work closely with our Business Operations teams to ensure accurate data and data lifecycles. You will collaborate with our IT team to optimize data integration and reporting processes.
Responsibilities
Develop and maintain data documentation, data dictionaries, and data flow diagrams.
Develop and implement data management policies and processes managing the data lifecycle, starting with data entry, to data hygiene and data quality control.
Manage and maintain Salesforce data to ensure accuracy and ease of reporting
Work with other members of Business Systems, BI, and Operations teams to optimize data integrations and reporting
Support BI and other analysts in analyzing data to identify trends, insights, and opportunities for improvement
Ensure that data in Salesforce is secure and compliant with regulatory requirements such as GDPR and CCPA

Required Qualifications
Extensive experience developing data dictionaries, working with data schemas, and manipulating large datasets with SQL and/or other tools.
Must be analytical and able to understand complex datasets. Work with stakeholders such as sales, services, customer success, customer account management etc, to understand their needs. Ability to deal with changing requirements in a dynamic environment.
This role will interact daily with senior executives, as well as peers in operations groups and IT. Ability to translate technical concepts into plain business language and vice versa is a must.
Excellent written and verbal skills, as well as polished appearance required.

Why Join Loftware?
“At Loftware, we enjoy an environment where our people can thrive individually and as part of a team. We look for highly motivated people who want to make a difference, a difference for themselves, their colleagues, and our vast customer base. Everyone’s contributions matter and are highly visible. We realize that we need to invest in our people and to allow for individual growth and career advancement. We train our people, provide them with challenging opportunities and collaborate across teams to ensure success.”
Robert O’Connor, CEO and President
Recognized as one of the Top 25 Best Companies to work for in New Hampshire by Business NH Magazine
Recognized as one of the Top 100 Private Companies in 2020 as published in Business NH Magazine
Loftware, Inc. (www.loftware.com) based in Portsmouth, NH, is an equal opportunity employer offering an aggressive compensation package, medical and dental benefits, and a 401K retirement plan.

Invitae (NYSE: NVTA) is a leading medical genetics company trusted by millions of patients and their providers to deliver timely genetic information using digital technology. We aim to provide accurate and actionable answers to strengthen medical decision-making for individuals and their families. Invitae's genetics experts apply a rigorous approach to data and research, serving as the foundation of their mission to bring comprehensive genetic information into mainstream medicine to improve healthcare for billions of people.
Data Analyst
Remote, US
The Customer Support team at Invitae is responsible for engaging with all customer types from patients to clinicians to partners. We strive to provide an exceptional customer experience while also building scalability into our business operations. We rely heavily on data to guide our objectives related to efficiency improvement and performance management,
We are looking for an internally motivated, detail-oriented, team player to support the business analytics needs of our group.
What you'll do:
Strategic Analysis & Financial Modeling - Working both independently and cross-functionally, help the company make and implement important business decisions by preparing operating and financial models and related written materials detailing your assumptions, considerations, recommendations, and alternatives. Requires proficiency in Return on Investment, Break Even analysis, and similar models for corporate-, program- and project-level decision making and performance tracking.
Performance tracking, reporting, and deviation analyses - In direct support of one or many of Invitae's core business units, prepare detailed analyses explaining not just the "what" of performance vs expectation (aka Budget vs Actual, which our finance team provides) but the "why" or "how" of what happened and what, if anything, our response should be in driving the business forward. Requires financial analysis and modeling skills; also benefits from using other analysis or BI tools (Tableau/Looker/PowerBI/etc, SQL or similar).
Independent thinking and problem solving - We are also asked to analyze all sorts of business situations both inside and outside the company. This requires someone who can think for themselves, attack - and enjoy! - challenging problems, and learn/understand new topics. Robots need not apply.
Analytics - Design and maintain business intelligence reports that further business goals and optimize effectiveness. This requires working with specific teams to understand their business requirements, and create reports that exhibit high clarity, maintainability, and reliability.
What you bring:
3-5 years in a data analytics role preferably in a startup environment where you've been exposed to multiple different types of business needs.
High proficiency in (and takes joy in) building out models in Excel / Google Sheets
2+ years experience with Tableau Server/Desktop and Looker
High proficiency using SQL
Adept at learning new software and technologies, which inevitably change in a fast-paced environment
Continually seeks solutions with the most positive business impact; doesn't simply execute instructions
Excellent data visualization skills (portfolio desired)
High attention to detail; uses rigorous quality control measure to test work appropriately
Excellent communicator; facility with user training and education.
Detail-oriented, proactive, flexible and able to handle multiple projects simultaneously
Thinks independently, and enjoys challenging problems.
Is collaborative, humble, team-first, constantly learning and improving

Please note that although all positions at Synctera are remote, candidates must be located and authorized to work in the US or Canada as a precondition of employment. Synctera does not sponsor applicants for work visas.
What We're Doing
At Synctera, we're powering the future of FinTech. We help companies create new revenue streams and enhance their value proposition with FinTech apps and embedded banking products. With APIs, compliance support, and bank partners in one end-to-end Banking as a Service platform, Synctera is the fastest and easiest way to build, launch, and scale bank accounts, debit cards, charge cards, lending, and more.
We are looking for interesting, curious, wickedly smart people who are ready to jump in and run with our fast-growing team. If you want to have fun at work, collaborate with some of the sharpest people in the industry, grow the FinTech and Banking as a Service ecosystem, and love to win, read on!
Who You Are
First, you're a full stack data person. You know the perils of CSV formats and you've had to rinse and clean more than your fair share of data. You're fluent in SQL, Data Visualization and Dashboarding. You know that all data is uncertain and there is measurement error in everything. You love to learn. You thrive by helping companies become faster, better-informed and more confident in their data-driven decisions.
There's a reason this section is first. Truly it's the very most important part of the role. It's central to who we are as a team and how we bring value to the company.
You know how to think, act and own
You understand that when you build things, sometimes you break things
You are able to work independently; and you know the power of a team
What You'll Do
This is the sixth person to join our team. Working across a variety of problem spaces, you'll bring understanding to our data - measuring how it's behaving and how our products are performing. From that platform, you'll start developing quantitative knowledge in our ecosystem. Your work will inform almost every aspect of our business, and will be visible throughout our community. It will give our customers and partners unprecedented visibility into their portfolios on our platform.
As our team grows, you'll mentor the folk who come after you. You'll continue to help our internal stakeholders understand and use the results of your analysis and experimentation to better inform our business decisions.
What You'll Bring
Your work background:
5+ years' of professional experience as a Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Experience being part of a small team being built from the ground up
Ability to think through problems and develop solutions quickly as a phenomenal problem solver
Solid technical background; experience with working on systems that process imperfect data.
Results-oriented; someone who knows how to get the job done regardless of circumstance
Your technical background:
Strong expertise in SQL (or equivalent)
Deep experience with one or more data Visualization tools - we use Metabase, but Looker, Tableau, Matplotlib or Mode are all relevant alternatives. You'll have designed dashboards for many different internal stakeholders. You know what it takes to cause data not simply to inform but to inspire action.
Problem Solver: Ability to think through unstructured problems, break them down, propose and validate solutions, and execute
Your data background:
Experience sourcing, validating, and cleaning your own data, as well as working across teams to design new data collection structures to fill gaps in current data collection
Experience with working on systems that process imperfect data
Your education background:
It doesn't matter where - or if - you went to school. What matters is that you have "Science Thinking" and you're meticulous & curious
What's a Plus
We don't do that. Anything else you have is a plus. Everything you want to learn is a plus. Come as you are. We want to help you become a better version of yourself
What Else We'd Love to Learn About You
Prior art
Help us understand what you've done. Seeing a little of the work you've done will go a long way. Examples include, but are not limited to, the following:
A GitHub/GitLab repo with some of your public work
Your public.tableausoftware.com work examples
Slides from prior public/scholastic presentations, challenges or tests
Hobby projects
Also: it's ok if you don't have anything like this. None of what we're describing are barriers. Everything is about getting to know you better.
Diversity & Inclusion
Synctera is committed to having a workforce that is reflective of the diversity within the United States and Canada. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from candidates from underrepresented communities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of diverse sexual orientation and gender identity, and all those who can provide different perspectives and contribute to the diversification of Synctera.
Benefits
100% employer paid medical, dental, and vision benefits for US and Canadian employees and dependents
Employer contribution to HSA for US employees
Annual HCSA and generous extended health care coverage for Canadian employees and dependents
401(k) for US employees and RRSP for Canadian employees
Mental health resources available for all employees
Unlimited paid time off
Generous paid new parent leave program
Home office setup stipend
Stock options program for all employees
Growth potential and opportunity to have a significant impact at an early stage of our company's journey
Working with a team of rockstars (+ a monthly happy hour with the team!)

Job Description:
At Regions, the Data and Analytics Analyst transforms data into a meaningful format for operational and/or decision-making purposes. Focusing on day-to-day deliverables, this role works with senior analysts and managers to gather and interpret data for leaders to make data-driven decisions.

Primary Responsibilities
Assists in preparing reports that are valuable, readable, and presentable to stakeholders
Assists in the preparation of visual reports/presentations to present analysis to management
Interprets, analyzes, and provides insights to teams and managers to determine operational impact, trends, and opportunities
Performs data analysis to help achieve data automation
Creates and maintains databases to help classify & store information
Completes day-to-day deliverables and ad-hoc data reports to support business needs/projects and answer data related questions
Ensures compliance by performing quality data audits, mining, and management
Monitors data and analytics trends and seeks opportunities for continuous improvement
Partners with the centralized Data Governance team to implement and support data governance and data quality requirements

This position is exempt from timekeeping requirements under the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not eligible for overtime pay.

Requirements
Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Statistics, or related field
Or, a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance, Statistics, or related field and two (2) years of experience in a data analytics or related role

Preferences
Experience utilizing analytical software such as Structured Query Language (SQL), Statistical Analysis System (SAS), SAS Enterprise Miner, and applicable Microsoft Office applications
Working knowledge of business intelligence software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)

Skills and Competencies
Demonstrated leadership capabilities
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
Strong verbal, written communication, and organizational skills
Strong work ethic and self-motivation

This position may be filled at a higher level depending on the candidate’s qualifications and relevant experience.

This role would be classified as a Flex/Hybrid role.
Majority of the work would be remote, with the requirement of one day per week in office. Office is Riverchase Operations Center in Hoover, AL

Additional Preferences
Experience with programming languages for data analytics (e. g. Python, Spark, Scala, Java, R)

Position Type Full time

As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for collaborating with leadership to identify data analytics opportunities, and to design, develop and deliver reports, dashboards and analytical projects. You will design innovative analytic approaches to test hypotheses, extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data, and develop recommendations to drive business performance. You will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver across our organization.
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university; or ten (10) years of progressive experience with the implementation, operation, programming and development of data and business intelligence solutions, or an equivalent in a related field, or the equivalent combination of training, education and experience.
Experience in the application of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, forecasting, cost-benefit analysis, related analytical tools and programming languages. Extensive experience in problem resolution including determining root cause, scope and scale of issues. Experience working in an Agile development and project management environment.
Advanced skill interpreting, extrapolating, interpolating data and SQL skills. Understanding and communicating data presented in models, charts, and tables and transforming it into a format that is useful to the business and aids effective decision making.
Knowledge of various data structures and the ability to manipulate data within visualization tools such as Tableau, Oracle BI, or Microsoft Power BI. Data warehousing, data cleaning, and other analytical techniques required for data usage.
Effective skill in the use of measurement and statistical practices to analyze current and historical data to make predictions, identify risks, and opportunities enabling better decisions on planned/future events. Knowledge of the process of sourcing raw data and cleansing techniques.
Compensation and job title is commensurate with experience under the following pay ranges:
Data Analyst I: $71,458 - $107,187
Data Analyst II: $79,496 to $119,244

We offer a competitive total rewards package including a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire
Salary: $80 - $115k/yr
Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.
Ideal Skills & Requirements:
· Proficiency working with HRIS, databases and reporting applications
· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
· Ability to work extended hours as necessary to fulfill time sensitive responsibilities
· Commitment to the office and firm

Partner with the best
As Pipeline Data Analyst, you will be delivering pipeline and process services to the oil and gas market globally. In line, Inspection (ILI) and Integrity Engineering (IE) are services that provide inspection and pipeline integrity reports for our customers globally.

Interpreting data and the production of pipeline inspection reports for our customers, on-time and to the required quality

Identify quality or productivity issues and potential solutions
Processing ILI data from the field following strict procedures and parameters

Fuel your passion

Come join First American's Digital Title Group, newly formed to re-imagine and digitize the title search and examination process through Big Data, AI, document automation and modern, cloud-native application development. As a market leading title insurance company, powered by the nation's largest and most complete property information, ownership and recorded document database, First American is committed to advancing title automation and removing friction from the real estate closing process. Title: Education Data Analyst
Hiring Range: Commensurate up to 65,000
Pay Band: 4
Agency: Department of Juvenile Justice
Location: Bon Air JCC
Agency Website: https://www.djj.virginia.gov/pages/admin/human-resources.htm
Recruitment Type: General Public - G
Job Duties
The Virginia Department of Juvenile Justice (DJJ) protects the public by preparing court-involved youth to be successful citizens. DJJ is committed to excellence in public safety by providing effective interventions that improve the lives of youth, strengthening both families and communities within the Commonwealth.

The Education Data Analyst will collect, manage, analyze, and report educational data in an effort to improve and evaluate educational programs. This includes developing, implementing, and monitoring data collection systems and other strategies to monitor and track performance; identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets; facilitating data-driven conversations for continuous improvement efforts; and developing data analysis reports for education and agency use.
Minimum Qualifications
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Highly proficient in the use of Microsoft Office Software (i.e., Excel, Word, PowerPoint) to also include spreadsheet applications and database management. Technical experience using data analytics tools and software. Experience in data cleaning. Extract information from various tables to perform an analysis. Experience in data visualization. Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings. Ability to establish effective working relationships with students, colleagues, and the supervisory team. Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively and professionally in all interactions. Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks based on approaching deadlines. Must possess the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and in an organized manner. Able to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive information. This professional-level position requires significant experience with planning and conducting organizational studies, sophisticated statistical research, juvenile justice, OR any other combination of training and experience which indicates possession of the above knowledge, skills, and abilities.
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree from a college or university with major coursework in research methods and statistics in the fields of social sciences, public or business administration, planning, or related field. Experience using academic data to impact instruction and school systems thinking and planning preferred.

Job_Title: Senior Analyst, Airbnb for Real Estate
Job_Description:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.
The Community You Will Join:
The Airbnb for Real Estate team is an entrepreneurial group within Airbnb partnering with Real Estate owners and operators to normalize hosting across multifamily while reimagining the way people live. By leveraging Airbnb as an Amenity, our partners are able to drive incremental revenue, increase leasing velocity and renewals at their communities all while providing flexibility and affordability to thousands of renters across the country (world). We move fast and are passionate about serving our hosts and customers. We are looking for people that want to collaborate with us to change the way people live!
The Difference You Will Make:
As a Senior Real Estate Data Analyst for Airbnb for Real Estate (A4RE), you will sit on the Business Strategy & Operations team. You will serve as a partner to both Go-To-Market and Data Science. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for creating financial models utilizing internal Company data, rent rolls, property financial statements to help Multifamily understand the value of the Airbnb as an Amenity. In addition, you will work with Data Science to analyze data and draw conclusions to present to Leadership and other key stakeholders about business trends and opportunities.
The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who has good analytical and problem-solving abilities. We are looking for someone who has the ability to develop a strong analytical framework, break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution and implement it using advanced quantitative methods. You have the ability to work within tight deadlines, balance short-term needs with long-term strategic initiatives, and utilize data to clearly outline business predictions or proposals.
A Typical Day:
Create financial models independently and incorporate complex structures or nuances
Partner with key stakeholders to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities. Inform, influence, support, and execute our sales strategy based on data analysis.
Own analytical framework to gather and analyze data (collect, clean, extract, transform, interpret) and draw conclusions to present to Leadership and other key stakeholders
Develop visualizations to make your sophisticated analyses accessible to a broad audience
Participate in internal initiatives to ensure the business is well-managed and operates efficiently
Develop a comprehensive understanding of Airbnb data structures and metrics and what drives the business
Work collaboratively across the business to find opportunities for using data to provide meaningful analytics to drive business solutions and support key operational and strategic initiatives
Share your high-quality insights and recommendations to peers and leadership in order to influence or drive faster business decisions
Prepare a rolling 24-month financial forecast for the business working closely with relevant stakeholders for inputs
Refresh financial forecast each month with inputs from Product and Go-to-Market Supply teams
Exercise discretion, independent judgment and problem solving abilities to complete work assignments
Your Expertise:
BA/BS level degree in Business, Economics, Information Systems, Computer Science, or Data Science
5+ years of relevant work experience
Working knowledge of SQL or other tools for querying large datasets
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (Tableau, Mode, Looker, etc.)
Ability to perform quantitative analysis including data mining on highly complex data sets
Experience applying your analytical skills to contribute to projects or programs which have had a proven impact on business performance and process
Strong Excel proficiency
Excellent communication, organization, and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to multi-task under tight deadlines
High attention to detail and the desire to take ownership of a process to drive towards resolutions
Strong motivation with the ability to work without supervision, keen judgment and a pay for performance attitude
Possess the professionalism and composure to provide client focused business while also managing internal relationships

Your Location:
This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.
Our Commitment To Inclusion & Belonging:
Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com. Please include your full name, the role you're applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process.
We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.

How We'll Take Care of You:
Our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future. This role may also be eligible for bonus, equity, benefits, and Employee Travel Credits.
Pay Range
$140,000—$167,500 USD

Develop code to create time series report to interpret how things change over time in various aspects of a data model. Slicing and dicing the data to create joins, macros and getting the data into data sets and writing it into logic code. Translate BI reports to understand trends, interpret data and collaborate with the business on recommendations to present externally to regulatory bodies. Collaborate with other design and optimize code. Provide innovative solutions to help the client to improve and automate their reporting. Perform ad hoc reports and reconciliation to ensure that the data producing is accurate compared to another server. Ad-hoc reporting as needed to assist the default servicing team in resolve mortgage delinquencies. Contribute to the creation of application throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).recommended software upgrades to optimize efficiency. Company overview:
With an annual budget of $2.3 billion and more than 7,000 employees throughout the five boroughs, the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (NYC DOHMH) is one of the largest public health agencies in the world, serving 8 million New Yorkers from diverse ethnic and cultural backgrounds. We're tackling a broad range of public health issues with innovative policies and programs and getting exceptional results, but our work is never finished. The breadth of our innovative programs provides the widest range of choices for every member of our team.
With grant funds from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), DOHMH is undertaking a new initiative that will meet critical infrastructure needs and make possible strategic investments that will have lasting effects on public health. Investments and improvements through this initiative will help modernize DOHMH’s foundational capabilities and data infrastructure, enabling it to partner in complex health and health care environments and, in turn, support better public health outcomes, including COVID-19. This initiative supports larger efforts to rebalance investments in public health and more equitably serve communities and populations.
The selected candidate will be an employee of Public Health Solutions, a nonprofit organization which is the fiscal and administrative manager of the grant but will work be supervised by DOHMH. This is a grant-funded position ending in November 2027.
Program Description:
The New York City Health Department works every day to protect and promote the health of more than 8.5 million diverse New Yorkers. This includes centering health equity and racial justice in all the work the Agency does. To support this mission, the Bureau of Epidemiology Services (BES) conducts systematic data collection and monitoring, rigorous analysis, and effective data communication. BES seeks to provide accurate and timely public health data to inform decision-making, to optimize data use, and to ensure accurate analysis of health data. The Bureau is responsible for developing, collecting and facilitating the use of population-based surveillance survey data and other data sources; and providing support to DOHMH in study design, questionnaire development, and survey weighting. The Bureau of Epidemiology Services Surveys and Data Analysis Unit is responsible for providing rapid response to data requests from other Bureaus, the Commissioner of Health, and external users to help shape programs and policies around the city.
Summary of Position:
The analyst will take the lead on creating analytic datasets from Social Determinants of Health survey data. The analyst will also assist in supporting the exciting new Healthy NYC survey panel. Healthy NYC is a panel of 9,000 probabilistically selected adult New Yorkers who participate in public health surveys throughout the year on a range of topics, including opinion surveys and surveys about specific dimensions of health. The analyst will facilitate the implementation of Healthy NYC surveys by creating tracking tables to manage which panelists are invited to take which surveys, and by preparing and checking lists of panelists invited to take surveys, as well as other panel management tasks. Finally, the data analyst will prepare and analyze other survey datasets that Bureau of Epidemiology Services collects and makes available so that the Bureau fulfills its important mission in making data available for public health decision-making.
Duties:
The analyst will, under the supervision of their supervisor and Bureau leadership:
Prepare Healthy NYC survey tracking tables to mange which panelists are invited to take which surveys
Prepare Healthy NYC survey invitation lists to invite panelists to take surveys
Process Social Determinants of Health Survey data to prepare them for analysis, including recoding variables, creating codebooks, and creating documentation about the datasets and results
Support preparation processes of other surveys housed by the Bureau of Epidemiology Services, such as the Community Health Survey, NYC KIDS, the Youth Risk Behavior Survey, and the Health Opinion Poll.
Generate tables and other types of analyses from the Bureau of Epidemiology Services survey datasets that are requested by internal and external requesters
Contribute to DOHMH efforts to promote health equity and racial justice
Qualifications:
Advanced SAS experience strongly preferred
Experience working with complex survey data
Training and expertise in epidemiologic data analysis techniques
Attention to detail
Strong data management skills
A strong sense of teamwork and collaboration
Enthusiasm for checking teammates’ data analysis results and having their own data analysis results checked by teammates
A commitment to DOHMH efforts to promote health equity and racial justice
Salary - $85,000- $85,000

Additional Desired Qualities
Experience with stakeholder engagement and project management.
Excellent communication (verbal & written) and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical skills and ability to manage and report complex information.
Experience with data collection, analysis and interpretation.
Desire to grow professionally, develop new skills and willingness to work outside of comfort zone.
Experience working with the public health sector and coordinating projects involving multiple stakeholders.
Ability to prioritize and work in fast-paced environment with hard deadlines.
Fluency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.
Additional Information:
This is a temporary grant-funded position ending in November 2027.
This individual must reside in the tri-state area (NY, NJ, CT) by their confirmed start date.
Preference may be given to individuals residing in New York City (5 boroughs) or surrounding New York State counties.
This individual will be expected to work non-business hours during emergencies.
NOTE: All applicants must comply with PHS’ vaccination policy. Effective October 1, 2021, employees will be required to provide verification that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (with an FDA-authorized vaccine).

ConnectiveRx is a leading, technology-enabled healthcare services company. We work strategically with hundreds of biopharmaceutical manufacturers to help commercialize and maximize the benefits of specialty and branded medications. Our mission is to simplify how patients get on and stay on therapy. We fulfill our mission by providing our customers with innovative services such as patient and provider messaging, the design and operation of copay, vouchers and patient affordability programs, and hub services, all of which accelerate speed-to-therapy and help improve outcomes for manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients.

ConnectiveRx was formed in 2015 by bringing together the industry-leading business of PSKW, PDR/LDM, Careform (2017) and The Macaluso Group (2018) to advance our technology-driven expertise in providing state-of-the-art commercialization solutions. To learn more about our company, visit ConnectiveRx.com

Job Description

Reporting to the Manager of Business Intelligence, the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for supporting client and HUB operations with a variety of data and analytical services. The incumbent will use complex data analytic techniques to aggregate data into meaningful and impactful visual representations to be provide to client contacts at planned intervals and to fulfill ad hoc requests. The incumbent will also be responsible for performing standard statistical analyses, presenting results, and developing thorough documentation of the programming and results. Assistance with presentations, reports, and manuscripts preparation will be required.

What you will do:
Collaborate with members of the operations leadership teams to understand business requirements, trends and expectations for analysis.
Produce ad-hoc reports under tight deadlines for various client requests.
Partner with IT staff to validate data attributes and to assure consistent integration across several data sources.
Build database queries and deliver reports and dashboards using tools such as Tableau, Looker, Salesforce, MS Excel.
Collaborate with the marketing and business development teams, as needed, to measure program effectiveness and track KPIs.
Manage projects and ensure that deadlines are met and remain consistent with stakeholder expectations.
Provide ongoing analytical and technical support of existing data sources, data integration, operational reports and dashboards.
Develop and maintain relevant documentation.
Collaborate with senior management on a strategic vision and roadmap for ConnectiveRx's operational data solutions.
Analyze ways internal business users leverage historical data to understand trends, answer questions, and create standardized report automation to reduce the need for ad hoc reporting requests.
Participate in design sessions for new systems and features to enhance business processes.
Monitor daily and weekly inbound and outbound data feed exchanges to ensure on-time delivery and complete and accurate data.
Diagnosis of inbound/outbound file issues through a documented quality control process.
What we will need from you:
Bachelor's degree in analytics, computer science, economics, mathematics, statistics, or a related field required.
2+ years’ experience in an analytics role, client facing preferred
Experience in analytics; querying, munging, and managing large data sets. Must understand the business question, design the analytics solution to answer that question, and explain the answer to the client.
Experience in the pharmaceutical industry or life sciences strongly preferred
Strong computer skills required, with knowledge in database-management systems such as Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle required.
Intermediate SQL writing skills required.
Experience building Dashboards and Reports with a Business Intelligence tool such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Looker required,
Strong written and oral communication skills, must be able to explain complex analytics to a non-technical audience
Passionate about using data to improve patient medication access and affordability
Strong organizational skills: ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Desire to work in an entrepreneurial environment, and take ownership of responsibilities
Ability to effectively use communication tools to work within a team that is not all located in the same office
Mindset to continuously learn and develop
Why work with us?
Excellent company culture, fun events, and volunteer opportunities
Competitive benefits (medical, dental, vision & more)
401k package with dollar-for-dollar match-up
Generous PTO and paid holidays days offered
Opportunities to grow professionally and personally
Team-oriented atmosphere

It’s an exciting time to join the WellSense Health Plan, a growing regional health insurance company with a 25-year history of providing health insurance that works for our members, no matter their circumstances.
The Quality Data Analyst will provide data analysis expertise in support of the Quality department while participating in documentation, dashboard development and reporting of quality measures. This role will primarily focus on data and analytics by analyzing raw data and providing actionable recommendations to improve quality measures. Additionally, the Quality Data Analyst supports all operational regulatory reporting and ensures compliance with both the Massachusetts Executive Office of Human Services and New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services regulatory reporting requirements for the ACO, SCO and MCO programs. Presents measures insight and recommendations to all levels of management for decision making and strategic planning. Controls and develops internal/external information sources for business analysis. Analyzes critical data and works closely with business leaders across the department to develop strategies to drive improvements to all Quality measures.
Our Investment in You:
Full-time remote work
Competitive salaries
Excellent benefits
Key Functions/Responsibilities:
Prepares presentations and recurring and ad hoc reports to support the Quality Improvement Department
Researches and selects clinical, financial, operational, and other measures used to provide quality and performance insight and decision support
Collects and documents business requirements from dashboard requestors, advises on source data and choice of visualization
Translate business requirements into product-specific designs and configuration, detailed requirement specifications and use cases
Performs and guides others through the business requirements gathering process
Develops and presents data reports and other complex information to executive leadership and stakeholders

Tracks/Monitors overall changes to dashboard post-dashboard development
Analyzes benchmarking data, reports, processes, and measurements
Validate methodology for NCQA & CMS calculations/changes and ensures annual changes are executed for dept. efficiency
Extract reports from multiple data source platform and present in a meaningful way
Assist with identifying opportunities for improvement and developing solutions using established performance improvement methodologies
Coordinates a variety of requests simultaneously and ensures timely completion in accordance with business initiatives
Develops innovative approaches to achieve deliverables
Responsible for supporting corporate initiatives and projects
Stay informed with the latest industry trends and best practices
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Education Required:
Bachelor's degree in statistics, economics, finance, business, accounting, science, healthcare, social science, mathematics or any field conductive to the development of critical and analytical thinking skills
Education Preferred:
Master’s degree in a related field is desirable but not required
Experience Required:
Three (3) years of experience analyzing and reporting healthcare data
Two (2) years' experience in using SQL or Python scripting for databases queries
Experience Preferred/Desirable:
Experience with Medicaid and Medicare managed care quality measures

Strong knowledge in Microsoft Office with emphasis in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio Critical Thinking, analysis, and problems solving

Role Summary
The Business Intelligence Analyst works in a fast-paced, high-exposure team whose responsibilities include data analysis, demand modeling and research, optimization, project management, and solution design/delivery. The BI team will translate business intelligence strategy into advanced analytical experiments and models that blend data sources for creative insights into business problems and to align performance with the company’s strategic goals, detailed action plans, key performance indicators, and progress metrics. The team also develops and implements systems and technology to produce decision support tools that enable leaders and system practitioners to take strategic action. You must be able to develop visualizations grounded in statistical best practices that facilitate effective communication of results and key findings to internal and external customers.
Key Duties
In the intermediate level (Professional 2), you will use solid understanding of BI principles to analyze data, make recommendations for approach to problem solving and make recommendations for solutions to complex business problems.
In the senior level (Professional 3), as a subject matter expert in business intelligence, you will apply deep knowledge and use considerable judgement to determine the approach to ambiguous challenges, exercise considerable judgement to make decisions and influence across the company.

Advanced SQL skills.

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire

Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.

· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.

· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
