It’s an exciting time to join the WellSense Health Plan, a growing regional health insurance company with a 25-year history of providing health insurance that works for our members, no matter their circumstances.
The Quality Data Analyst will provide data analysis expertise in support of the Quality department while participating in documentation, dashboard development and reporting of quality measures. This role will primarily focus on data and analytics by analyzing raw data and providing actionable recommendations to improve quality measures. Additionally, the Quality Data Analyst supports all operational regulatory reporting and ensures compliance with both the Massachusetts Executive Office of Human Services and New Hampshire Department of Health and Human Services regulatory reporting requirements for the ACO, SCO and MCO programs. Presents measures insight and recommendations to all levels of management for decision making and strategic planning. Controls and develops internal/external information sources for business analysis. Analyzes critical data and works closely with business leaders across the department to develop strategies to drive improvements to all Quality measures.
Our Investment in You:
Full-time remote work
Competitive salaries
Excellent benefits
Key Functions/Responsibilities:
Prepares presentations and recurring and ad hoc reports to support the Quality Improvement Department
Researches and selects clinical, financial, operational, and other measures used to provide quality and performance insight and decision support

Extract reports from multiple data source platform and present in a meaningful way
Assist with identifying opportunities for improvement and developing solutions using established performance improvement methodologies
Coordinates a variety of requests simultaneously and ensures timely completion in accordance with business initiatives
Develops innovative approaches to achieve deliverables
Responsible for supporting corporate initiatives and projects
Stay informed with the latest industry trends and best practices
Other duties as assigned

Education Preferred:

Role Summary
The Business Intelligence Analyst works in a fast-paced, high-exposure team whose responsibilities include data analysis, demand modeling and research, optimization, project management, and solution design/delivery. The BI team will translate business intelligence strategy into advanced analytical experiments and models that blend data sources for creative insights into business problems and to align performance with the company’s strategic goals, detailed action plans, key performance indicators, and progress metrics. The team also develops and implements systems and technology to produce decision support tools that enable leaders and system practitioners to take strategic action. You must be able to develop visualizations grounded in statistical best practices that facilitate effective communication of results and key findings to internal and external customers.
Key Duties
In the intermediate level (Professional 2), you will use solid understanding of BI principles to analyze data, make recommendations for approach to problem solving and make recommendations for solutions to complex business problems.
In the senior level (Professional 3), as a subject matter expert in business intelligence, you will apply deep knowledge and use considerable judgement to determine the approach to ambiguous challenges, exercise considerable judgement to make decisions and influence across the company.

Advanced SQL skills.
Demonstrated experience working with disparate data sources and data blending.
Adept at dashboard design, charting, and report automation.
Experience with applied statistics and probability.

Data-driven mindset and a proven history of continuous self-development.

Required

Detailed knowledge and understanding of business intelligence functions, including analytics, data mining, reporting, report conversion, data cleansing, data modeling and relational databases.
Advanced SQL skills.

Expert in visualization techniques, dashboard design, and decision support tools; experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Modeling proficiency in cluster analysis and linear regression.
Experience with descriptive and diagnostic statistics, sampling methodology, residuals analysis / ANOVA, and hypothesis / significance testing.

Appointment Type:

Description:
Chancellor's Office Statement
Join our team at the California State University, Office of the Chancellor, and make a difference in providing access to higher education. We are currently seeking experienced candidates for the position of Data Center Systems Analyst. The CSU Chancellor's Office, located on the waterfront adjacent to the Aquarium of the Pacific in downtown Long Beach, is the headquarters for the nation's largest and most diverse system of higher education. The CSU Chancellor's Office offers a premium benefit package that includes outstanding vacation, health, and dental plans; a fee waiver education program; membership in the California Public Employees Retirement System (PERS); and 14 paid holidays a year.
Salary
The salary range for this classification is $4,678 to $11,547 per month. The anticipated salary hiring range is up to $9,895 per month, commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Classification
Operating Systems Analyst
Position Information
The California State University, Office of the Chancellor, is seeking a Data Center Systems Analyst to provide administration, maintenance, and operating systems support in a multi-site 24/7/365 data center and cloud services environment, including installation, setup, monitoring, configuration testing, development, security, and troubleshooting of operating systems, enterprise applications, virtualization technologies, backup, and automation tools.
Responsibilities
The Data Center Systems Analyst is primarily responsible for providing administrative, and operating system support focused on Unix and Linux servers, Cloud services, and cross-platform technologies.
Duties include:
Maintain Unix/Linux server-based applications in a multi-site 24/7/365 environment.
Setup, configure, maintain, troubleshoot, and automate systems deployment within on-premises data centers and cloud-hosted environments such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, and other similar provider environments.
Develop, implement, document, and maintain a standard operating environment (SOE) for all servers, including baseline operating system images, templates, and maintenance of required support tools and applications.
Develop scripts, packages, and other tools to optimize administration, monitoring, and system deployment.
Provide support for Backup Systems, including implementation, maintenance, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
Assist with the administration and support of Windows Servers, Active Directory, Active Directory Integration, and other Windows Enterprise Server-based applications, including Office 365 applications and administrative services.
Gather business requirements, architect, document, and implement IT solutions and meet operational needs.
Plan and execute lifecycle of core services, operating systems, and supporting hardware upgrades.
Perform routine system administration functions such as patch deployment, user account management, and security.
Meet or exceed customer Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Provide 24x7 operational support, after-hours on-call, and maintenance support for all systems.
Develop and maintain Linux and Windows run books.
Provide advanced-level troubleshooting and interface with customers to resolve problems.
Monitor systems for failure and respond to resolve impacts, and determine the root cause.
Maintain systems security and ensure compliance with system-wide and Chancellor's Office policies.
Maintain the integrity and reliability of systems.
Develop detailed hardware plans, systems operation & technical procedure guidelines.
Adhere to the Chancellor's Office security policies and guidelines in the daily performance of systems administration activities.
Research and provide cost analysis for technology solutions.
Consult with and train technical staff as needed.
Participate in the evaluation of technologies and in developing processes to implement a uniform and consistent methodology of maintaining system and application security.
Implement, maintain, and support datacenter hardware, including servers, blade chassis, and storage systems.
Implement, maintain, and support virtualization platforms.
Gather business requirements, architect, document, and implement IT solutions to meet operational needs.
Recommend and establish policies and procedures to meet operational requirements of key services.
Provide support to desktop and user-support teams to resolve systems and server-related issues.
This position is also responsible for any other duties as assigned. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for keeping current in the industry, including technology changes, trends, and best practices. The incumbent is also responsible for addressing any concerns regarding technical operations with the appropriate supervisor. This position also provides on-site support as operational needs require and coverage for "after-hours" on-call support.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent combination of education and work related experience.
Seven to ten years of professional experience supporting a production Unix/Linux environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Communication & People Skills
Solid written communication skills and the ability to provide accurate technical documentation.
Ability to motivate others and build team morale.
Work effectively and cooperatively with other team members to achieve goals, strengthen working relationships, and optimize end-user services.
Ability to effectively communicate with end-users with varying technical expertise.
Effectively communicate and listen and work with others to problem solve.
Ability to gather information, apply solid judgment, and disseminate information.
Analytical Skills
Ability to independently troubleshoot, identify problems, and appropriately respond to situations that impact operations.
Develop practical and thorough solutions.
Identify problems, use appropriate sources to research technical problems, and learn with little to no guidance.
Ability to independently apply technical judgment to decisions that ensure application and system stability, uptime, and security.
Project Management Skills
Ability to track and document information between multiple parties.
Experience in coordinating resource requirements.
Attention to detail and solid organizational skills.
Ability to schedule and prioritize to meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently with little supervision.
Ability to lead a project and implementation teams.
Technical Skills
Extensive experience administering Unix and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge of Windows systems and related hardware.
Experience working in a heterogeneous Windows/Unix/Linux environment is preferred.
Experience installing, configuring, and managing IIS and Apache web servers and web applications preferred.
Concrete understanding of Windows and Unix security, including file system permissions, file sharing, and event logging.
Experience with cloud-hosted environments such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, and other similar provider environments is required.
Experience with VMWare ESXi and vSphere Virtual Infrastructure is required.
Experience with Storage Area Networks (SAN) and Network-attached storage (NAS) technologies and Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) is preferred.
Thorough understanding of enterprise backup technologies implementation is required.
Proficiency with Internet and Windows protocols and standards, including TCP/IP, ICMP, DNS, SMTP, SNMP, SSH, DHCP, IMAP, POP3, MAPI, WINS, CIFS, and any emerging protocols and technologies.
An in-depth understanding of LAN/WAN technologies, including switching, routing, and Internetwork Operating System is required.
Experience with Cisco or Alcatel-Lucent networking equipment is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Productivity Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), Microsoft Project, and Visio required.
Application Period
Priority consideration will be given to candidates who apply by February 16, 2023. Applications will be accepted until the job posting is removed.
How To Apply

Reasonable accommodations will be provided for qualified applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting the Senior Human Resources Manager at (562) 951-4070.

If hired, you will be required to furnish proof that you are legally authorized to work in the United States.

The CSU requires faculty, staff, and students who are accessing campus facilities to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or declare a medical or religious exemption. Any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to comply with this requirement as a condition of employment. The systemwide policy can be found at

Job Description:
Job Description
Outcomes Management
The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet the changing needs of the organization.
POSITION TITLE: Health Care Data Analyst
JOB SUMMARY: This position will be responsible for coordinating efforts among quality management support staff to produce data-based work product analyzed in accordance with bio-statistical principles and methods; creating related presentations for use by hospital and medical staff leaders,and serving as an "interpreter" between Information Technology and clinical staff when it comes to problem-solving technical issues.
ASSIGNMENT AREA: Outcomes Management
HOURS OF WORK: Monday-Friday, 0800-1630 with requirements for flexible hours.
RESPONSIBLE TO: Director Patient Safety & Quality
PRE-REQUISITES:
Associate degree in health care field required, preferably in Health Information Management, a clinical field or healthcare informatics. Bachelor's degree preferred.
Minimum 2 years recent employment in acute health care setting.
Experience in use of electronic health record (EHR).
QUALIFICATIONS:
Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite®; particularly Excel/QI Macros, Access and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of research methodology, principles, procedures, and bio-statistical analyses.
Knowledge of data management and basic coding.
Ability to design, implement and maintain systems necessary to retrieve, analyze, report, and file data; skilled in graphic development and presentation.
Thorough knowledge of describing data, testing hypotheses and examining relationships among variables.
Proficiency in use of Excel's Analysis Tool Kit and QI Macros or equivalent statistical analysis software.
Ability to generate reports from various software programs and databases, using quantitative and qualitative data in performance measurement and improvement.
Ability to deliver effective written and oral reports and presentations.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information as required.
Requires planning, organizing and working on multiple tasks at one time.
Requires deep concentration for a large volume of work that must be completed within a limited period of time to meet deadlines for reporting.
UNIQUE PHYSICAL DEMANDS, ENVIRONMENT, AND WORKING CONDITIONS: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner
PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILIES:
A. Generic Job Functions: See Generic Job Description/Administrative Partner
B. Essential Responsibilities and Competencies:
Support the organization-wide quality management, patient safety and performance improvement program through retrieval, analysis and reporting of data internally and externally in accordance with regulatory requirements and organization-wide standards.
Produce reports and information as requested within established time frames.
Develop and maintain competency in clinical decision support systems (including but not limited to Truven's CareDiscovery Transform and Quality Measures, Quality-Net Exchange).
Identify and report variations in clinical care that require immediate follow-through.
Utilize various software applications for data collection, analysis and reporting.
Participate in the discussion of study design and data elements and make recommendations to fulfill the scope and objectives of the study.
Coordinate and support efforts of quality management, infection control, and clinical staff to complete data collection and reports in accordance with intent (validity and reliability) and timelines.
Create interactive (drop-down menu) databases to facilitate accuracy of abstractors with repetitive data entry and analysis.
Analyze, report, and interpret data results, utilizing performance improvement tools and techniques such as graphs, run charts, control charts, and statistical process control in performance improvement reports to Patient Care Services, Medical Staff Departments and Administration.
Apply bio-statistical analyses for physician peer review and reappointment profiling.
Prepare PowerPoint slides for administrative and physician presentation to quality committees and licensing/accrediting bodies.
Provide comparative data for PI teams to identify best practices; keep staff and committees aware of publicly reported data reports.
Troubleshoot technical issues between Outcomes Management and liaisons to various software programs used.
Resolve data conflicts and maintain integrity of databases.
Function as a technical resource for others who use the same software systems and databases (e.g. Truven: CareDiscovery Quality Measures and Transform; Q-Net; Leapfrog, Excel).
Function as a resource person to physicians, leadership, and staff in the analysis and interpretation of internal and external data and reports (e.g. NDNQI).
Perform other duties as assigned.
Revised: 3/19
Grade: NCNM 22, 24, 26
FLSA: E
CC: 8714

Job Qualifications:
PRE-REQUISITES:
Associate degree in health care field required, preferably in Health Information Management, a clinical field or healthcare informatics. Bachelor's degree preferred.
Minimum 2 years recent employment in acute health care setting.
Experience in use of electronic health record (EHR).
QUALIFICATIONS:
Thorough knowledge of MS Office Suite®; particularly Excel/QI Macros, Access and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of research methodology, principles, procedures, and bio-statistical analyses.
Knowledge of data management and basic coding.
Ability to design, implement and maintain systems necessary to retrieve, analyze, report, and file data; skilled in graphic development and presentation.
Thorough knowledge of describing data, testing hypotheses and examining relationships among variables.
Proficiency in use of Excel's Analysis Tool Kit and QI Macros or equivalent statistical analysis software.
Ability to generate reports from various software programs and databases, using quantitative and qualitative data in performance measurement and improvement.
Ability to deliver effective written and oral reports and presentations.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of data and information as required.
Requires planning, organizing and working on multiple tasks at one time.
Requires deep concentration for a large volume of work that must be completed within a limited period of time to meet deadlines for reporting.

As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for collaborating with leadership to identify data analytics opportunities, and to design, develop and deliver reports, dashboards and analytical projects. You will design innovative analytic approaches to test hypotheses, extract actionable insights by identifying patterns in structured and unstructured data, and develop recommendations to drive business performance. You will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver across our organization.
Position Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree from a four-year college or university; or ten (10) years of progressive experience with the implementation, operation, programming and development of data and business intelligence solutions, or an equivalent in a related field, or the equivalent combination of training, education and experience.
Experience in the application of statistical methods, mathematical techniques, forecasting, cost-benefit analysis, related analytical tools and programming languages. Extensive experience in problem resolution including determining root cause, scope and scale of issues. Experience working in an Agile development and project management environment.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will play a central role in study onboarding, system configuration, and data migration activities for users of an enterprise-class Sample Management System (SMS). Reporting to the Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) Operations and Project Manager, the Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will follow established and evolving program policies, procedures, and best practices in support of data migration and system configuration projects. The incumbent will work with internal UCSF customers on the manual inventory of onsite UCSF freezers, tanks, and other storage locations holding biospecimens. They will document findings and prepare data for import into the appropriate system following team best practices and UCSF data privacy and security policies. The Data and Laboratory Inventory Analyst will also work with the BSIP teams to support activities related to the BioCatalyst system as needed. This position will involve collaboration and work in partnership with other BSIP team members and UCSF organizations, including the Biospecimen Services Program (BSP), CTSI Sample Processing Lab (SPL), the Clinical & Translational Science Institute (CTSI), and other stakeholders throughout the UCSF research enterprise.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will participate in, and contribute to, BSIP team meetings, retrospectives, project planning, and process improvement sessions. They will act as a subject matter expert (SME) for aspects of BSIP managed systems within UCSF and participate in user group meetings. The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will attend BSP meetings as needed.

This is a 1 year contract from start date with full benefits package.
Department Description
The Office of the Associate Vice-Chancellor of Clinical Research (AVC-CR), a division within the Office of Research, provides executive leadership for the UCSF clinical research community to support enterprise-wide administration, infrastructure, and services. This includes representation of the UCSF clinical research community to the Vice Chancellor of Research (VCR), other UCSF leadership, and extramural stakeholders. The office of the AVC-CR works with campus clinical research leadership to improve clinical research support across sites, schools, and disciplines. The office directs and facilitates the development and implementation of innovative programs and activities that address the priorities of the clinical research community. These include programs in clinical trials operations, enterprise-wide biobanking, clinical trial data sharing, and additional areas of need. The AVC-CR also directs and serves as principal investigator for the Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI). CTSI spans the four UCSF health science schools (Medicine, Pharmacy, Nursing, and Dentistry), the UCSF Graduate Division, and collaborating affiliates of UCSF. The mission of CTSI is to facilitate clinical and translational research to improve patient and community health. CTSI does this by providing infrastructure, services and training to make research more efficient. CTSI develops broad coalitions and partnerships at the local, regional and national levels to enable a transformation of the research environment. CTSI has $26M in annual budget from multiple funding sources (NIH, institutional, philanthropy, industry and other) and includes over 20 interdisciplinary programs.

The UCSF Biospecimen Services Program has been in operation since 2015 and was founded to facilitate translational research efforts by coordinating biospecimen activities in support of the research enterprise. The Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) plays an instrumental role in the strategic development of an infrastructure that supports technologies and expertise for biospecimen collection, processing, storage, and distribution as well as implementation of informatics systems that ties all components of the pipeline together. BSIP is currently responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and sustainability of the MBioLIMS and BioCatalyst Systems at UCSF. MBioLIMS is a vendor supported biospecimen sample management system which is used to track and catalog activities associated with biospecimens acquired for research purposes. BioCatalyst is a first-of-its-kind biospecimen search engine developed at UCSF which ties de-identified sample data to clinical and other data via system integrations and an honest broker operational model.
Required Qualifications

Minimum 1+ years of related experience
Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.
Intermediate knowledge of related areas of IT
Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Demonstrates problem-solving skills
General knowledge of business and process analysis functions
Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization
Demonstrated ability to work with Microsoft Office Excel
Within two (2) months of start date, take all appropriate training for work with the MBioLIMS, REDCap, and BioCatalyst systems, and for appropriate clearance of work/exposure to biohazardous substances

About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.
Pride Values
UCSF is a diverse community made of people with many skills and talents. We seek candidates whose work experience or community service has prepared them to contribute to our commitment to professionalism, respect, integrity, diversity and excellence – also known as our PRIDE values.

In addition to our PRIDE values, UCSF is committed to equity – both in how we deliver care as well as our workforce. We are committed to building a broadly diverse community, nurturing a culture that is welcoming and supportive, and engaging diverse ideas for the provision of culturally competent education, discovery, and patient care. Additional information about UCSF is available at diversity.ucsf.edu

Join us to find a rewarding career contributing to improving healthcare worldwide.

Company Overview
ID.me simplifies how people securely prove and share their identity online. The company empowers people to control their data through a portable and trusted login, which means they don't need to create a new password when visiting sites that have the ID.me button.
The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated digital migration for many critical services. Those services require a trusted identity to safeguard against fraud and help ensure people are who they claim to be. With ID.me, login and identity credentials move with people, which can reduce the time and frustration of having to verify at multiple sites and set up multiple passwords.
ID.me is a credential service provider compliant with federal standards for digital identity verification.
In addition to helping people control their credentials and data, the company's "No Identity Left Behind" initiative strives to expand access and inclusion for all people. The company offers multiple pathways to verification – online self-serve, live video chat agents, and in person. ID.me is passionate about building a robust identity network that does not compromise access for traditionally underserved groups.

Overview:
The Business Analyst (BA) role serves as a key intersection between various information technology solutions, the providers of these solutions, and their users within Forefront Dermatology. Business Analysts are responsible for mapping workflows, identifying pains, opportunities to gain efficiency, and innovating to thoughtfully solve while ensuring solutions may be measured for efficacy, adoption, and success whenever possible. The BA collaboratively prioritizes and advocates effectively to solve the most meaningful problems in the most measurable way.
Responsibilities:
Develop and leverage extensive expertise in tasks, workflows, and supporting systems within a domain.
Represent the voice of the user and clearly represent their needs and objectives in the form of problems to solve, opportunities, and pain points.
Identify, measure, and report on key success metrics.
Own the adoption and utilization of technology solutions leveraged within domain, ensuring obstacles and risks are identified and thoughtfully mitigated or accepted.
Intimate understanding of most important business objectives/jobs to be done within their domain, and keeps this at the forefront of decisions.
Advanced technical skills.
Familiar with and advocate for multi-disciplinary best practices, including cybersecurity, privacy, regulatory, and other compliance areas.
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Triages and represents issues and opportunities back to existing vendors.
Leads new initiative assessment campaigns, and curates opportunity roadmap for domain.
Challenge status quo constructively in search of opportunities to automate, optimize, and measure.

Qualifications:
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business or related field, or in lieu of degree, equivalent education, training and work-related experience
Minimum 2-5 years of experience in business analyst, functional analyst, or product management roles
Demonstrated leadership experience including serving as an example to others with regard to professional behavior, handling multiple tasks, maintaining a positive and constructive attitude, and in response to organizational change

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Must be detail oriented, curious, and able to document both workflow and technical needs effectively.
Excellent communication skills including creating reports and presentations and effective delivery to peers, stakeholders, and leadership.
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required, as are workflow mapping and SDLC tools.
Ability to work effectively and cooperatively with staff, board, clients, and the public.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize appropriately, and work well both individually and as part of a team.
Ability to use time productively and contribute to high levels of company operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of information.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will play a central role in study onboarding, system configuration, and data migration activities for users of an enterprise-class Sample Management System (SMS). Reporting to the Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) Operations and Project Manager, the Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will follow established and evolving program policies, procedures, and best practices in support of data migration and system configuration projects. The incumbent will work with internal UCSF customers on the manual inventory of onsite UCSF freezers, tanks, and other storage locations holding biospecimens. They will document findings and prepare data for import into the appropriate system following team best practices and UCSF data privacy and security policies. The Data and Laboratory Inventory Analyst will also work with the BSIP teams to support activities related to the BioCatalyst system as needed. This position will involve collaboration and work in partnership with other BSIP team members and UCSF organizations, including the Biospecimen Services Program (BSP), CTSI Sample Processing Lab (SPL), the Clinical & Translational Science Institute (CTSI), and other stakeholders throughout the UCSF research enterprise.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will participate in, and contribute to, BSIP team meetings, retrospectives, project planning, and process improvement sessions. They will act as a subject matter expert (SME) for aspects of BSIP managed systems within UCSF and participate in user group meetings. The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will attend BSP meetings as needed.

This is a 1 year contract from start date with full benefits package.
Department Description
The Office of the Associate Vice-Chancellor of Clinical Research (AVC-CR), a division within the Office of Research, provides executive leadership for the UCSF clinical research community to support enterprise-wide administration, infrastructure, and services. This includes representation of the UCSF clinical research community to the Vice Chancellor of Research (VCR), other UCSF leadership, and extramural stakeholders. The office of the AVC-CR works with campus clinical research leadership to improve clinical research support across sites, schools, and disciplines. The office directs and facilitates the development and implementation of innovative programs and activities that address the priorities of the clinical research community. These include programs in clinical trials operations, enterprise-wide biobanking, clinical trial data sharing, and additional areas of need. The AVC-CR also directs and serves as principal investigator for the Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI). CTSI spans the four UCSF health science schools (Medicine, Pharmacy, Nursing, and Dentistry), the UCSF Graduate Division, and collaborating affiliates of UCSF. The mission of CTSI is to facilitate clinical and translational research to improve patient and community health. CTSI does this by providing infrastructure, services and training to make research more efficient. CTSI develops broad coalitions and partnerships at the local, regional and national levels to enable a transformation of the research environment. CTSI has $26M in annual budget from multiple funding sources (NIH, institutional, philanthropy, industry and other) and includes over 20 interdisciplinary programs.

The UCSF Biospecimen Services Program has been in operation since 2015 and was founded to facilitate translational research efforts by coordinating biospecimen activities in support of the research enterprise. The Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) plays an instrumental role in the strategic development of an infrastructure that supports technologies and expertise for biospecimen collection, processing, storage, and distribution as well as implementation of informatics systems that ties all components of the pipeline together. BSIP is currently responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and sustainability of the MBioLIMS and BioCatalyst Systems at UCSF. MBioLIMS is a vendor supported biospecimen sample management system which is used to track and catalog activities associated with biospecimens acquired for research purposes. BioCatalyst is a first-of-its-kind biospecimen search engine developed at UCSF which ties de-identified sample data to clinical and other data via system integrations and an honest broker operational model.

About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Summary:
Reporting to the Manager of Data Operations, the incumbent in this position supports all performance improvement efforts. Responsibilities include accessing and collecting, organizing, displaying, analyzing, validating, formatting, and presenting data for the purposes of utilization management, revenue optimization, and quality improvement. They prepare reports and or presentation materials in the final form within specified time frames.
The incumbent also works collaboratively with peers and leadership in order to determine business requirements and analyze reporting needs. This includes active participation in selected teams.
Job Responsibilities:
1) The data analyst is responsible for accurately managing data, including data collection from multiple sources. Integrate data captured into the operational workflow. These sources include internal and external data sources and benchmarking sources.
2) Accesses, collects, organizes, displays, analyzes, validates, formats, and presents data for the purposes of utilization management and revenue optimization in a format that is meaningful to the intended customers. This includes accurately and appropriately understanding and summarizing data using metrics common to the industry.
3) Produces multiple useful and insightful report types for a variety of purposes related to quality reporting and demographic analysis as requested by administrative leaders. This includes generating various reports such as standard, ad hoc, and complex reports using office productivity software.
4) Communicates effectively with all levels of leadership regarding requirements necessary to complete reports and provide a summary of data.
5) Works collaboratively to maintain provider information and patient data flow.
6) Manages multiple projects, meets time constraints and expectations.
7) Coordinates and compiles the data for providers, often requiring collaboration with
departments throughout Baycare, including clinical managers, physicians, and appointment schedulers within medical practices, and appointment schedulers.
8) Adhere to industry reporting standards and standards for quality control.
9) Developing strategic plans for data analysis to include a strategy to achieve agreed targets and effective planning.
10) Manage and carry out analysis of agreed data while complying with financial and legal requirements, responsibilities, and obligations
11) Preparing reports for management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
12) Performs other duties as directed.

Company : ABC Fitness Solutions
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Job Description
What you’ll do
The Data Conversion Analyst is responsible for facilitating the manipulation of data from multiple software platforms in order to convert a database from an existing billing system to ABC Fitness Solutions IBM iSeries and the Oracle based software, Datatrak. Processing the conversion using different software tools, such as, Actian, Excel, MS Access, SQL,etc. is a tedious job requiring extreme attention to detail. A complete understanding from the business analyst perspective is required in an effort to purify the data as it is converted. The Data Conversion Analyst will evaluate the data during the conversion process, identifying exceptions, anomalies, and variations in the data. Upon identifying, the aforementioned conditions will be documented and communicated to the client for clarification.
The Data Conversion Analyst will work with the client throughout the conversion process, continuing the evaluation and review of the data. The Data Conversion Analyst will prepare the data, make the necessary adjustments at an account level, preparing the account to be activated and billed. That Data Conversion Analyst will remain assigned to the client for the entirety of the transitional period to assist them with their acclimation to our company.
Maintain consistent review of the data conversion schedule. Must be constantly aware of all recent and future conversion outlined on the schedule.
Review formatted data to ensure all records, fields and tables have been formatted appropriately.
Verify all necessary backup and supporting tables are included in the file.
Is responsible for verifying the required documentation from the Project Manager has been received according to the timelines established.
Review all data conversion documentation provided by the Project Manager and the client. Identify any pre-conversion questions or concerns. Communicate this to the Project Manager.
Communicate with the Project Manager and Data Conversion Architect to ensure the success of the conversion.
Using Actian, MS Access, SQL and MS Excel; create detailed documentation outlining any and all variations, exceptions, and anomalies in the data.
Communicate with the Project Manager and the client regarding all variations and exceptions in the data.
Communicate any specific instructions, procedures or processes needed based on requirements of each specific client in the areas of Data Processing, Client Services and any other relevant division of the company
Provide post conversion and post amendment documentation to client.
Communicate the finalization of the transition period
What you’ll need
Knowledge of I-Series database platform
Knowledge of SQL
Advanced in Microsoft Office products
Self starter: Ability to multi-task projects with multiple deadlines
Flexible schedule
Excellent organizational skills
Must be able to excel in a fast-paced work environment
Ability to make independent decisions and take calculated risks
Must be able to accurately and effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
Must be extremely detail-oriented and able to make sound decisions
Professional Phone Skills
High school diploma or equivalent
College degree (preferred)
Must have minimum 2 + year experience as a Data Conversion Analyst
What’s in it for you:
Purpose led company with a Values focused culture – Best Life, One Team, Growth Mindset
Time Off – with our open PTO policy, you pick when you want time off when it’s best for you!
Days of Disconnect – once a quarter, we take a collective breather and enjoy a day off together around the globe. #oneteam
Parental & Pawternity Leave – we offer leave for when your family grows by two feet or four paws!
Fitness Perk – we are committed to meeting you wherever you are in your fitness journey with a quarterly reimbursement
Discounts – access to discounts with our partners, such as Dell, Microsoft & many more.
Medical/Dental/Vision coverage
EAP – we get you help when you need it.
Calm App +4 – enjoy tranquility with a Calm App subscription for you and up to 4 dependents over the age of 16
And more! – so many benefits we couldn’t even fit then all here!
We’re committed to diversity and passion, and encourage you to apply, even if you don’t tick all the listed skillsets!

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.
The Data Protection Team (Data Loss Prevention) within Ford’s Global Cyber Security team, is looking for a highly skilled quantitative analyst / data scientist to assist in model development, evaluation, and deployment. You will have the opportunity to work with some of the brightest global subject matter experts that are transforming the Data Loss Prevention team.
The focus will be to apply advanced quantitative methods to solve a wide variety of challenging decisions in DLP, utilizing analytic technologies such as SQL, Python, Alteryx, Qlik Sense, and other dashboard/visualization toolsets for data intelligence and analysis, to improve efficiency of Ford's business and reduce cost.

The minimum requirements we seek :
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Cyber Security, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics.
2+ years’ of experience doing quantitative research using techniques from one or more of the following areas: 1) machine / deep learning, 2) natural language processing, 3) statistics / statistical modeling, 4) optimization / mathematical programming.
1+ years’ of experience in data manipulation using software tools such as SQL, Alteryx and API.
1+ years’ of experience in at least two of the following languages: R, Python, MATLAB, Java, Scala, Julia, C/C++/C#
Our preferred requirements :
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Cyber Security, Operations Research, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics.
Experience with Data Loss Prevention tools such as: ProofPoint, Symantec or Microsoft.
What you’ll receive in return:
As part of the Ford family, you’ll enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings, and stock investment plans, incentive compensation, and much more. You’ll also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.
Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position .
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.
For information on Ford's salary and benefits, please visit: https://corporate.ford.com/content/dam/corporate/us/en-us/documents/careers/2022-benefits-and-comp-GSR-sal-plan-1.pdf
At Ford, the health and safety of our employees is our top priority. Vaccination has been proven to play a critical role in combatting COVID-19. As a result, Ford has made the decision to require U.S. salaried employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless employees require an accommodation for religious or medical reasons. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination or an approved medical or religious exemption.

What you’ll be able to do :
Research and apply the latest quantitative techniques toward the solution of important DLP decisions
Convert data into actionable insights by predicting and modeling future outcomes
Build out data using Python and Alteryx to identify efficiencies in DLP policies
Execute regular production reports as well as descriptive and inferential ad hoc requests in a timely manner
Work with and understand DLP data sources to gather data
Assist with DLP incident investigations by leveraging and correlating data from internal sources to build an actionable mosaic user profile
Assist with DLP alert triage and remediation efforts to support the team's data protection goals
Work closely with the DLP global team community (EU, AP (India and China), and Mexico teams)
Review academic and industry literature, develop proof-of-concept models, and gain insights from research findings
Translate ideas and theory into solutions that business can benefit from
Communicate with business partners to understand the problems and translate high-level ideas into well-defined mathematical formulations
Enforce quality assurance of analytic solutions through technical governance process
Have the intellectual curiosity to identify and develop new modeling technologies/methodologies/software packages to improve the current modeling processes

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire
Salary: $80 - $115k/yr
Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.
Ideal Skills & Requirements:
· Proficiency working with HRIS, databases and reporting applications
· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
· Ability to work extended hours as necessary to fulfill time sensitive responsibilities
· Commitment to the office and firm

3 years

Monday to Friday

Job Title: Senior Data Analyst - Marketing
Reports to: Director of Digital Growth

Location: Remote*
Must reside in one of the following states: CA, CO, CT, FL, GA, IL, MA, MD, MN, NJ, NY, NC, PA, TX, UT, VA, WA or Washington DC
FLSA Classification: Exempt
About Us
Opentrons Labworks, Inc., is a disruptive life science company leveraging its integrated lab platform to supercharge the pace of innovation in research and healthcare. Opentrons Labworks is the parent company to business units Opentrons Robotics and Neochromosome. Through Opentrons Robotics, thousands of institutions are automating R&D operations with flexible, easy-to-use liquid handling lab robots. Through Neochromosome, biopharma and biotech at large can benefit from our world-class genome-scale cell engineering solutions. Learn more at https://www.opentronslabworks.com/.
We provide excellent benefits, competitive compensation, equity packages, and opportunities for growth. If you are looking for your next exciting opportunity, come join us!
Benefits
Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision insurance for employees and their families
Paid Vacation, Parental and Sick Leave
Generous Stock options
401k with 4% company match
Long-term and short-term Life & Disability insurance
And much more!
About the role
The Senior Data Analyst will have a direct and immediate impact on nearly all of Opentrons’ go-to-market efforts to bring affordable lab automation to scientists worldwide. In this role, you will enable business leaders to make effective decisions and work more efficiently. You will also enable our programs to be managed and optimized with more sophistication. The Senior Data Analyst is an integral part of the team and your efforts will amplify the efforts of everyone around you.

What You Will Do
Use Tableau to create reports, data visualizations and dashboards that serve as a single source of truth across Finance, Sales, Operations and Marketing
Work cross-functionally with go-to-market stakeholders to Identify business priorities, surface trends, and scope analytics projects
Build a strong partnership with Data Engineering and Analytics Engineering consultant and/or team members, helping them define pain points and opportunities to help address with data and BI infrastructure improvements e.g. Stitch, Snowflake, Meltano, and similar
Conduct root cause analysis for business questions and deliver findings through structured story-telling
Proactively set & communicate accurate project estimates; deliver timely insights
Become an expert in methodology and rationale used to calculate key metrics and KPIs of the company. Develop data dictionaries to ensure tight alignment.
Deploy predictive analytics to enable sales and marketing automation, including projects like lead scoring, send time optimization, and more
Facilitate public information scraping efforts to help grow our database e.g. funding, core labs, and primary/secondary authors of life science publications
What We are Looking For
Education:
Bachelor's degree preferred or equivalent experience
Experience:
Minimum of 4 years of experience in data analysis or similar role analyzing complex data sets, in a go-to-market environment required
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities:
Tableau is your primary data visualization tool; you are very comfortable with SQL
You’re motivated by helping advance life science’s ability to solve important problems through lab automation
You are a naturally curious person with inclination and skills for conducting evidence based inquiries
You have a knack for translating data into easily understood and actionable insights, and are excited about utilizing data to make strategic business decisions
You are able to apply a consultative approach and break complex questions down using data
Reviewing analytical output and packaging it for a business audience comes naturally to you
You are unafraid to present data that contradicts anecdotal evidence
You understand the importance of providing timely and actionable insights
Compensation Details: The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $105,000 and $145,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and years of experience. We typically target mid-range for well-qualified candidates. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including equity and full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Opentrons is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

We, at Leggett & Platt Inc., are searching for a(n) Logistics Analyst within our Business Support Services team to help support our Corporate business. As a global-diversified manufacturing company, it’s sometimes hard to explain all the different things we do. We like to say, “we’re the biggest company no one has ever heard of.” We are confident you interact with one of our products in your daily life without knowing it. Whether it’s the mattress you sleep on, the car you drive, the plane you fly on, or the furniture you sit on, our high-quality components are there supporting you. If you join our team, your work will ensure people across the world have a little more comfort in their lives.

As a(n) Logistics Analyst you will have the opportunity to interact with all branches and business units. Your contributions will have a direct impact on the business by finding competitive rates that prevent excessive costs, as well as ensuring shipments are made in a timely manner. The team you will be working with is fun and hard-working, and values the versatility that working in international shipping brings to the table.
So, what will you be doing as a(n) Logistics Analyst?
Maintain International Freight Rate database(s) that may include imports, exports, drays and foreign to foreign trade lanes
Execute quote requests for Air, Ocean modes of transport with approved Service Providers and communicate proposals
Provide analysis support for freight spend for Logistics & L&P Business Units
Work with the team to expand our capabilities with new or existing 3rd Party Service Providers to support Air, Ocean & Dray with the quoting process, SOP development and on boarding process
Identify & document Cost Savings opportunities
Perform other duties as assigned
Assist with carrier rate negotiations for all modes of transport including export and import shipments (Air, LCL, FCL, Dray)
Analyze data from various databases (using Excel, E2OPEN and other data management systems) to perform ad hoc reporting and analysis as directed

To be successful in this role, you’ll need:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 2 years of International Transportation experience working for an ocean carrier or freight forwarding company
Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks while maintaining a high degree of accuracy
Proficient in Microsoft Office with strong mathematical aptitude and attention to detail
Expertise level in Excel
Ocean contract maintenance and negotiation is required
Power BI Dashboard experience is a plus

GENERAL SUMMARY:
The data analyst serves as the statistical expert and analyst to support reporting throughout the department. The data analyst assists with department data and reporting needs including data entry, report creation, database management, and analysis. The data analyst generates administrative, financial, and operational reports as needed and requested. Additionally, the data analysts help to support the information technology needs of the department including system support, user training, troubleshooting, and problem resolution. The data analyst prepares and creates reports for executive level presentation. The data analyst oversees and manages the block boarding process within the operating room and maintains strong relationships with physician offices. Familiarity with Microsoft Office and the electronic medical record Epic are requirements of the job. A successful data analyst should be process and procedure driven and have excellent communication skills. The data analyst must be highly organized and have ability to work in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities. The data analyst must have exceptional customer services skills and a proactive attitude with strong attention to detail.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

1. Develops, creates, runs and compiles statistical, administrative, financial, and operational reports and provides data analysis as needed to support perioperative services.
2. Maintains system database, ensure data integrity, provides user training and support and assists department with system use and interaction.
3. Supports the IT needs of the department.
4. Oversees and manages the surgical block boarding process.
5. Demonstrates the delivery of exceptional internal and external customer service behaviors in every aspect of the job and (100%).

What's cool about this job
The Voice of Customer (VOC) Analyst contributes to REI’s success by providing customer research analysis to decrease decision risk, increase overall profitability, and inform the evolution of best-in-class experiences across customer touchpoints. The position supports and represents the voice of the customer across the Co-op to advocate a customer-focused approach to business. The Analyst’s primary focus will be to complete recurring analysis, identify root causes of customer issues/pain points, and deliver concise, impactful summary of findings. Secondary focus will be to; build surveys, implement changes within the survey platform, track survey results, and deploy surveys/feedback tools across digital properties. Models and acts in accordance with the Co-op Way (values & mission).

Your Planning & Navigating Requirements
Design and execute effective surveys across VOC platforms
Analyze, report, and track information to identify data patterns and customer pain points. Uses multiple sources of data including structured and unstructured customer research, benchmarks, demographics and internal operational data. Experience in analyzing unstructured data for rule-based categorization and sentiment analysis.
Support VOC team share outs with VOC insights distilled across co-op listening channels, to drive actionable and data-driven recommendations.
Engage in dialogue with stakeholders to understand the scope and impact of any potential causes or changes to the customer experience, aiding interpretation of VOC insights.
Technical expertise in digital data analytics and testing tools, specifically Adobe (Analytics, Test & Target) to enable the integration of VOC toolset into ABN testing
Participate in the processes for Customer Survey Change Control and CX Dashboard Access Control
Contribute to the development of an enterprise VOC solution, including technical implementation of new VOC platforms/systems/tools, vendor onboarding and management, integration and ongoing data integrity maintenance of the VOC ecosystem. Requires technical/code-level understanding of tools (e.g. Qualtrics, Adobe, Tealium, Lexalytics, Maritz) and data warehouses
Provides collaborative ad-hoc decision support and represents the voice and needs of customers among internal partners
Perform regular deep dives and root cause analyses of top customer pain points
Leverage metrics, feedback, and other data to understand the customer experience, identify pain points, and opportunities for improvement.
Experience in analyzing unstructured data for rule-based categorization and sentiment analysis, to identify key themes, trends, and insights that will drive action among key partners
Bring your passion and expertise
2+ years of VOC, customer experience (CX), analytics, data, marketing, or other relevant experience.
High empathy to see the world through the customers eyes. Acts as an advocate for customer in the interest of building a customer-centric culture.
Experience managing all phases of quantitative research design, survey programming, data collection, analysis, and delivery of results. Proven experience in research management.
Effective written and verbal communication skills, including demonstrated ability to explain and defend data analysis at all levels within the organization, including senior leadership. Proven ability to adapt communication style to audience (both written & verbal).
Experience completing in-depth analysis of structured & unstructured customer research data, identifying root cause of customer issues/pain points, and making recommendations on training opportunities, process improvements, and/or technology enhancements.
Ability to work independently and efficiently with a minimum of supervision. Ability to proactively manage expectations and work effectively in a collaborative, cross-divisional environment.
Proven experience using survey platforms (such as Qualtrics, business intelligence programs (such as Tableau), and statistical software (such as SPSS) to analyze data. Intermediate to advanced knowledge/use of business-related PC applications, such as Excel, Word, Outlook, and Power Point.
Works smart by setting effective work goals, establishing priorities, using resources efficiently, meeting deadlines, and proactively keeping others informed of work plans and progress.
Industry knowledge and Voice of the Customer (VOC) training and/or certification.

Information Services (IS) is the central information technology unit at the University of Oregon and provides wide ranging services to campus. Established in 1876, the University of Oregon offers a breadth and depth of curricula with more than 270 academic programs and provides the opportunity to work at a respected research university with a strong holistic, liberal arts foundation. With branches in Portland and on the Oregon coast, the UO is deeply connected to Oregon's natural and cultural treasures.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will play a central role in study onboarding, system configuration, and data migration activities for users of an enterprise-class Sample Management System (SMS). Reporting to the Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) Operations and Project Manager, the Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will follow established and evolving program policies, procedures, and best practices in support of data migration and system configuration projects. The incumbent will work with internal UCSF customers on the manual inventory of onsite UCSF freezers, tanks, and other storage locations holding biospecimens. They will document findings and prepare data for import into the appropriate system following team best practices and UCSF data privacy and security policies. The Data and Laboratory Inventory Analyst will also work with the BSIP teams to support activities related to the BioCatalyst system as needed. This position will involve collaboration and work in partnership with other BSIP team members and UCSF organizations, including the Biospecimen Services Program (BSP), CTSI Sample Processing Lab (SPL), the Clinical & Translational Science Institute (CTSI), and other stakeholders throughout the UCSF research enterprise.

The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will participate in, and contribute to, BSIP team meetings, retrospectives, project planning, and process improvement sessions. They will act as a subject matter expert (SME) for aspects of BSIP managed systems within UCSF and participate in user group meetings. The Data and Lab Inventory Analyst will attend BSP meetings as needed.

This is a 1 year contract from start date with full benefits package.
Department Description
The Office of the Associate Vice-Chancellor of Clinical Research (AVC-CR), a division within the Office of Research, provides executive leadership for the UCSF clinical research community to support enterprise-wide administration, infrastructure, and services. This includes representation of the UCSF clinical research community to the Vice Chancellor of Research (VCR), other UCSF leadership, and extramural stakeholders. The office of the AVC-CR works with campus clinical research leadership to improve clinical research support across sites, schools, and disciplines. The office directs and facilitates the development and implementation of innovative programs and activities that address the priorities of the clinical research community. These include programs in clinical trials operations, enterprise-wide biobanking, clinical trial data sharing, and additional areas of need. The AVC-CR also directs and serves as principal investigator for the Clinical and Translational Science Institute (CTSI). CTSI spans the four UCSF health science schools (Medicine, Pharmacy, Nursing, and Dentistry), the UCSF Graduate Division, and collaborating affiliates of UCSF. The mission of CTSI is to facilitate clinical and translational research to improve patient and community health. CTSI does this by providing infrastructure, services and training to make research more efficient. CTSI develops broad coalitions and partnerships at the local, regional and national levels to enable a transformation of the research environment. CTSI has $26M in annual budget from multiple funding sources (NIH, institutional, philanthropy, industry and other) and includes over 20 interdisciplinary programs.

The UCSF Biospecimen Services Program has been in operation since 2015 and was founded to facilitate translational research efforts by coordinating biospecimen activities in support of the research enterprise. The Biospecimen Services Informatics Program (BSIP) plays an instrumental role in the strategic development of an infrastructure that supports technologies and expertise for biospecimen collection, processing, storage, and distribution as well as implementation of informatics systems that ties all components of the pipeline together. BSIP is currently responsible for the implementation, maintenance, and sustainability of the MBioLIMS and BioCatalyst Systems at UCSF. MBioLIMS is a vendor supported biospecimen sample management system which is used to track and catalog activities associated with biospecimens acquired for research purposes. BioCatalyst is a first-of-its-kind biospecimen search engine developed at UCSF which ties de-identified sample data to clinical and other data via system integrations and an honest broker operational model.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in related area and / or equivalent experience / training
Minimum 1+ years of related experience
Demonstrated ability to work with others from diverse backgrounds.
Intermediate knowledge of related areas of IT
Self-motivated and works independently and as part of a team. Able to learn effectively and meet deadlines. Demonstrates problem-solving skills
General knowledge of business and process analysis functions
Demonstrated effective communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate technical information to technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization Interpersonal and communications skills to work with both technical and non-technical personnel at various levels in the organization
Demonstrated ability to work with Microsoft Office Excel
Within two (2) months of start date, take all appropriate training for work with the MBioLIMS, REDCap, and BioCatalyst systems, and for appropriate clearance of work/exposure to biohazardous substances
This includes, but is not limited to, the following UCSF-provided training:
Blood borne pathogens

About UCSF
The University of California, San Francisco (UCSF) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. It is the only campus in the 10-campus UC system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences. We bring together the world’s leading experts in nearly every area of health. We are home to five Nobel laureates who have advanced the understanding of cancer, neurodegenerative diseases, aging and stem cells.

Overview:
The Data Analyst is responsible for managing large amounts of data, mastering the lifecycle of the data journey from source to general ledger, including reporting layer in Power BI / SSAS Cubes. This person will meet with stakeholders to understand their data needs and business questions, gather the appropriate data using SQL and other means to build the datasets. A successful candidate will take responsibility for managing our master data set, developing reports, and troubleshooting data issues. To do well in this role you need a very fine eye for detail, experience as a data analyst, and a deep understanding of the popular data analysis tools and databases.
Responsibilities:
Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Helping develop reports and analysis.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science.
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases.
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
High-level written and verbal communication skills.
Prior experience in reporting and data visualization solutions, consulting or business analysis.
Experience with Office particularly Excel, Visio, Power BI, and SharePoint.
Experience using SQL with BI software suites
3+ years experience, preferably with analytical responsibilities

Change. Control. Cholesterol, Target: Type 2 Diabetes, and IMPLEMENT-HF suite of Quality Improvement programs.

Strategic Planning: Collaborate with business team partners in development of American Heart Association strategic plans and Quality team business plans as it relates to program technology applications.

The American Heart Association’s 2024 Goal: Every person deserves the opportunity for a full, healthy life. At American Heart Association | American Stroke Association, diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunity applies to both our workforce and the communities we serve as it relates to heart health and stroke prevention.
