Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years.

As a People Data Analyst, you will leverage data to derive insights that will inform people-related strategies and drive process improvement. You will apply technical expertise to build, maintain, and analyze complex data sets, make recommendations, and implement solutions that increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the people analytics function. You will partner with Operations, Recruiting, and the rest of the business to fill gaps and create scalable processes that support organizational growth and success.
WHAT YOU'LL DO
You’ll both lead and help on critical People projects across the company, requiring you to quickly iterate on project plans and goals.
You’ll partner with leadership to understand the needs of the business and create easily digestible reporting (ex. recruiting analytics and headcount tracking)
You will identify opportunities for process improvement and automation, and work with relevant stakeholders to implement solutions that increase efficiency and accuracy in people analytics processes.
You will ensure data integrity and precision while helping facilitate data migration to cloud-based storage.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
You have an incredibly high execution bar and will see projects through to completion which will include conception, gathering customer input, implementation, and iteration.
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write complex and nuanced queries against new or unfamiliar data sets (and if you’re not proficient, you have the aptitude and ambition to become fluent!)
Experience working with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
You're user-centric, and know how the outputs of your work - data, process, or tooling - will impact those who touch it.
High ownership and low ego, approaching everything with clear outcome orientation and a high degree of humility
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
1+ years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably with a focus on people analytics
Familiarity with HRIS or ATS systems, and experience working with data in these systems
Experience with scripting languages such as Python or R
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and experience building data pipelines (we use dbt!)
$88,000 - $132,000 a year

The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in all offers; and are considered part of Anduril’s total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits, including comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Plans, employee life and disability, mental health and family planning benefits with all premiums paid by Anduril. Anduril provides fully paid medical leave, paid company holidays, and Paid Time Off. A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians, and all on-site meals fully subsidized during the work week with gourmet kitchens. The recruiter assigned to this role can share more information about the specific compensation and benefit details associated with this role during the hiring process.

Position Description

Performs entry-level data analysis and data research work. Work involves conducting detailed analysis and extensive research on data and providing results in various formats. Responsible for using standard statistical tools, methods and techniques to translate data into actionable insights using data visualization software. Works under close supervision, with minimal latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.
Essential Duties:
Accesses information from business organization cross-sections to make good business decisions and provide excellent customer service.
Consults with internal and external customers to identify user needs.
Compiles and queries data.
Analyzes data using standard statistical tools, methods, and techniques
Interprets results to identify significant differences in data.
Cleans and prunes data to discard irrelevant information.
Assists in defining, developing, and implementing data standards.
Responds to incoming requests from business areas to design, build, maintain or repair reports and applications.
Writes programs and/or queries for spreadsheet or database software to create reports and import/export data.
Performs other job responsibilities as assigned.

Description
We are seeking a self-motivated Data Analyst to provide technical and analytic support to a small, high-impact team. This is a developmental position with opportunities for career growth along a Data Science track. The position requires an active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance.
The Data Analyst will be expected to work with Data Scientists to build statistical models, test hypotheses, and interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report data findings. The Analyst may be required to leverage automation and machine learning models to manage data, predict scenarios, and make recommendations to a non-technical audience. The Analyst may be required to produce Finished Intelligence reports and serve as a bridge between Intelligence Analysts and Data Scientists.
The Data Analyst will contribute to building new analytical tools in support of the IC customer and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment. The Data Analyst will be expected to learn and leverage technical frameworks and collaboration technologies, including Amazon Web Service (AWS) and Git.
Requirements:
Experience with scripting in Python or R
Experience (either on-the-job or in an academic setting) working with data manipulation techniques and statistics
Experience producing Finished Intelligence products for IC customers
Knowledge of computer science concepts, data architecture, and common statistical models
Knowledge of all-source intelligence, including SIGINT, and/or HUMINT collection reports
Familiarity with cable writing styles and classified client databases, including specific targeting tools
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences
Familiarity with key US foreign policy and national security Counterterrorism (CT) objectives
Knowledge of IC policies and procedures
Ability to work efficiently in a metrics-driven environment
TS/SCI clearance with polygraph required
BS and 4 – 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 – 6 years of prior relevant experience.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Who We Are:
Headquartered in New York City, Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. is a leading developer, publisher, and marketer of interactive entertainment for consumers around the globe. The Company develops and publishes products principally through Rockstar Games, 2K, Private Division, and Zynga. Our products are currently designed for console gaming systems, PC, and Mobile, including smartphones and tablets, and are delivered through physical retail, digital download, online platforms, and cloud streaming services. The Company's common stock is publicly traded on NASDAQ under the symbol TTWO.
While our offices (physical and virtual) are casual and inviting, we are deeply committed to our core tenets of creativity, innovation and efficiency, and individual and team development opportunities. Our industry and business are continually evolving and fast-paced, providing numerous opportunities to learn and hone your skills. We work hard, but we also like to have fun, and believe that we provide a great place to come to work each day to pursue your passions.
The Challenge:
As Take-Two grows, we need to bring scale, repeatability and reliability to our data gathering and reporting frameworks. This will enable our business partners to expertly make decisions based on the vast amounts of data we have at our disposal.
The Data Analyst will work as part of multi-functional technical teams alongside business analysts, data engineers and other team members to deliver impactful data solutions to challenging user and business problems/needs. The individual will be responsible for converting data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. This person will conduct full lifecycle activities to include requirements analysis and design, develop analysis and reporting capabilities, and continuously monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
What You'll Take On:
Use SQL, Excel, BI Platforms and other analytics tools to analyze data from various sources, internal and external, to identify supported requirements, gaps, anomalies and special circumstances, business rules, and data management needs.
Define the structural and field-level transformation needed to align source data with target systems and data models.
Identify data quality issues. Recommend, implement and monitor preventative and corrective actions to ensure that quality assurance standards are achieved.
Build tables and views that to support reports and dashboards.
Bring standard methodology for our reports and dashboards. For example: establish consistency in metric definitions across different reports and dashboards.
Improve design, performance and functionality for existing Tableau dashboards
Ensure clear documentations are prepared for various components of our reporting platform, including details behind different dashboards, clear definitions of our data sources and metrics
Contribute to development, documentation and automation of reporting processes including error & reconciliation handling.
What You Bring:
Be able to work hybrid from T2 NYC location.
Technical background to include ETL, SQL Database & schema planning, reporting services, design and optimization. (3+ years)
Proficient in writing SQL (any variant) code efficiently. (3+ years)
Have technical experience in building reporting summary tables/views and be able to establish standard methodologies around their design and maintenance. (2+ years)
Experience of building dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau. (1+ years)
Demonstrable experience with Excel as a tool to analyze data.
What We Offer You:
Great Company Culture. Ranked as one of the most creative and innovative places to work, creativity, innovation, efficiency, diversity and philanthropy are among the core tenets of our organization and are integral drivers of our continued success.
Growth: As a global entertainment company, we pride ourselves on creating environments where employees are encouraged to be themselves, inquisitive, collaborative and to grow within and around the company.
Work Hard, Play Hard. Our employees bond, blow-off steam, and flex some creative muscles – through corporate boot camp classes, company parties, game release events, monthly socials, and team challenges.
Benefits. Medical (HSA & FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase plan, commuter benefits, in-house wellness program, broad learning & development opportunities, a charitable giving platform with company match and more!
Perks. Fitness allowance, employee discount programs, free games & events, stocked pantries and the ability to earn up to $500+ per year for taking care of yourself and more!
The pay range for this position in New York City at the start of employment is expected to be between $74,600 and $89,500 per year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role
The Sr Analyst – Unit Budgeting develops, implements, and maintains processes to collect, clean, and manage the data used to produce product unit budgets for Mass Markets leadership and stakeholders. Executes the budgeting process vision as directed by Mass Markets leadership. Creates and updates complex Excel and Tableau data modeling for unit analysis and reporting. Maintains a shared projects space for accurate and timely unit budgeting updates.
The Main Responsibilities
Communicates and executes unit budgeting vision, maintaining deadlines for reporting and changes to the unit budget.
Maintain and update a tracker for unit budgeting updates and communicates effectively with leaders and stakeholders.
Creates, updates, & maintains complex Excel data models (data links, formulas, visuals, etc.).
Updates monthly, quarterly, and annual presentations units Plan of Record (POR/Budget).
Alongside the Mgr., Budgeting/Forecasting, creates and maintains forecasting models aligned to POR/Budget.
Produces ad-hoc analyses as needed.
Maintains unit budgeting working site (version control, QA, repository, inventory, etc.).
Collaborates with cross-functional teams to understand complex business problems and build predictive models and tools.
Ability to execute data discovery, exploratory data analysis, and iteratively develop unit budgeting models to identify optimal solutions. Assist with operationalizing the solutions.
What We Look For in a Candidate

Job ID# 10225 – Posted 3/28/2023 – Remote, CA
Position Description
IT Data Analyst works independently to document external data acquisition policies and procedures as well as interface with other business units to define and document data needs and ad-hoc analysis requirements; identify business practice workflow and process issues and concerns; provide leadership and guidance to define system and process requirements that will optimize system performance and technology utilization by system users; and design information systems and technologies that ensure access and transparency. The Informatics Data Analyst will develop, implement, organize, and maintain information and reports to document operational and financial performance; collaborate with the quality team, administrators, etc., to design the ad hoc and other relevant routine reports; monitor the quality programs and make efforts to improve them; compile data from multiple sources and import the data into the relevant database; select appropriate tools and methods to maintain the existing programs that ensures there is appropriate transfer of data and that all the reports are documented well to increase the efficiency; assist with analysis of external data definitions documentation and mapping process; perform a Quality Assurance function for the data integration processes and repository metrics; collaborate with other staff to document data needs and metric definitions; validate data load processes and the quality of the data loaded into data repositories; maintain, store, map and analyze data in compliance with policies and procedures; coordinate with LAN and IT Security teams in order to utilize PGP encryption software and File Transfer Protocols; and use software such as SAS, Access, and Excel to provide data mapping for integration using Business Objects, and SQL.
Skills Required
IT Data Analyst will possess knowledge and experience in basic statistical concepts; identifying the trends, business opportunities, and relevant issues; commonly-used demographics and databases; definitions of fields and how data is entered and processed; data mining/intelligence; statistically-valid analysis and measurement methodologies; packaging data – infographics and other data display techniques, and report design options; data interpretation and validation; Ad Hoc analysis/performance evaluation principles; common demographic data bases; SQL coding and report services; data warehouse design; web-based application design; PC skills (e.g. Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SAS, Access and Excel); working independently as well as a leadership role in creating process documentation and interfacing with other team members to obtain this information; detailed-oriented; excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills; ability to handle multiple tasks; and problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Skills Preferred
The IT Analyst will possess knowledge and experience in:
– Solid knowledge in Microsoft Database architecture, including MS SQL Servers, Azure SQL, Azure Managed Instances.
– Work experiences in Database administration, ensuring data availability, data quality, and security.
– Extensive experience in database development, include design and developing databases, views, function, and stored procedures.
– Innovative – employ creativity to devise effective and efficient solutions
– Demonstrated critical thinking – including abilities in analysis and problem solving
– Experienced in “Systems Thinking” – the ability to break problems into manageable pieces, and to see how the pieces interact with one another and can be assembled into an integrated, functioning, “whole” system
– Excellent verbal and written communication capabilities
– Effective team player with strong emotional intelligence – self-awareness, confidence, ability to manage conflict, and empathy
– Passion for technology, with an ability to understand and assess new technologies, and their potential applicability to business needs in an efficient, effective manner
Experience Required
– Minimum of two (2) years of experience in processing, management, and retrieval of information.
Experience Preferred
Four (4) years of database development experience
Two (2) years developing data integration processes including secure Web services and APIs
Two (2) years developing Microsoft Power Automate or Logic Apps or PowerApps
Three (3) years of Database development experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Stored Procedures using T-SQL.
Two (2) years developing data reports using Microsoft SSRS, PowerBI, Power BI Report Builder.
Two (2) years of DevOps experience.
Education Required
This classification requires the possession of a bachelor’s degree in an IT-related or Engineering field. Additional qualifying experience may be substituted for the required education on a year-for-year basis.
Additional Information
Remote\Telework position

Job_Title: Senior Healthcare Data Programmer Analyst- Remote Opportunity
Job_Description:
Employment Type:
Full time
Shift:
Day Shift
Description:
The Senior Data Programmer Analyst serves as a senior technical resource to provide guidance on complex data processing and analysis tasks such as monitoring data quality, developing documentation, applying statistical methods and creating data visualizations for analytic teams across the organization. The responsibilities for this role include automating routine processes, identification and validation of appropriate data elements, and contribution to the design or architecture of data systems and environments. This role performs high-level data and systems analysis, modeling, feasibility studies and applies design principles in the assessment of computing environments. In addition, this role works with large, multi-complex data sources and technical platforms to collaboratively facilitate the transformation of data to knowledge.
This Senior Data Programmer Analyst develops reports and works in partnership with various technical and operational departments, analyzing user needs and developing solutions to meet the organizational requirements. Advanced communication skills, as well as the ability to simplify complex analytics concepts and to plan, prioritize, and seamlessly integrate all various segments to implement successful solutions. This role may have informal oversight responsibility for other team members. Project management skills are also paramount in building out solutions to support analytic initiatives using SAS, R, SQL, Python or other applicable tools to meet the specific needs of the organization.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
1. Must possess expert knowledge of relational databases, data warehousing, and data architecture as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor's degree in Health Science, Computer Science or a related technical field with six to seven (6-7) years of progressively responsible programming experience (including but not limited to SQL, SAS, Python, or R), and working with multiple, complex data sources and large volumes of data; or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
2. Epic Clarity certification required or obtained within three (3) months of hire
3. Expertise in front-end source systems and clinical workflows is required in order to perform effective validation of data.
4.Expertise in modular programming skills are required to support the most complex recurring production-level datasets.
5. Ability to write and influence others to write code that is clearly readable and efficient and can be explained to a variety of audiences.
6. Extensive experience in handling complex data sources and large volumes of data and finding creative solutions to intricate data problems.
7. Expert knowledge of statistical concepts and fluency in analytic approaches for health care outcomes.
8. Must be well organized and possess the ability to work under limited guidance, which includes setting one’s own and team priorities and proactively resolving any potential conflicts.
9. Must be able to make decisions based on logical thinking and ethical principles.
10. Excellent interpersonal skills to foster collaborative partnerships using a team approach to span traditional boundaries within a health care setting.
11.Must be proficient operating in a collaborative, shared leadership environment.
12. Must possess a personal presence that is characterized by a sense of honesty, integrity, and caring with the ability to inspire and motivate others to promote the philosophy, mission, vision, goals, and values of Trinity Health.
PHYSICAL AND MENTAL REQUIREMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS
1. Must be able to set and organize own work priorities and adapt to them as they change frequently. Must be able to work concurrently on a variety of tasks/projects in an environment that may be stressful with individuals having diverse personalities and work styles.
2. Must possess the ability to comply with Trinity Health policies and procedures. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of duties so assigned.

Min- $48.05/hr
Max- $79.28/hr

DayTwo is the leading microbiome-based precision nutrition company. DayTwo provides a food as medicine solution to help members manage their blood sugar levels based on their unique profile of their gut microbiome.
DayTwo members can eat what they love with small modifications and achieve balanced blood sugar levels while also reducing medications. Our unique app allows members the ability to create meals that reduce the incidence of high blood glucose levels and allows for better management of Type 2 Diabetes, as well as overall health. DayTwo is the leader in precision nutrition that enables a path to remission for metabolic disease. Our customers include some of the largest employers and payors in the US.
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst.

This position will support and advance data analytics initiatives across DayTwo’s Customer Success and Operations teams. Develop reporting for marketing campaign performance
Converting data into usable information that is easy to understand

Execute ad-hoc analysis for both internal and external stakeholders

Experience with data visualization and BI tools (QuickSight, Tableau) is a plus

Excellent time management, ability to prioritize, self-sufficiency
Excellent time management, attention to detail, and decision-making skills
Strong analytical critical thinking skills & highly organized.
Collaborative, positive, and demonstrates a problem-solving approach to work
Results-oriented approach and mindset, with a “can-do” attitude.
Demonstrated ability to build relationships and trust with others quickly, within in-person and virtual environments and with internal departments and external customers.
Team player who can also work independently.
You are comfortable working with varying timelines and technology.
You are comfortable communicating in a remote setting with both colleagues and members/clients
Capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously

Job Title – Brand Protection Data Analyst
Location – South San Francisco CA 94080
Duration- 12 Months
Work Authorization - Only US CITIZENS OR GREEN CARD HOLDERS
Job Description
As a member of the Product Lifecycle & Protection Team, you will analyze and visualize various sources of Brand Protection data related to pharmaceutical crime to help identify targets and trends and create trusted intelligence reports with well-reasoned recommendations. You will also support members of the Product Lifecycle & Protection team on other aspects of Brand Protection and process automation.
Role:
Conducts data analysis of the digital landscape to identify pharmaceutical crime (counterfeit, diversion, brand abuse).
Gathers and analyzes the content of websites, social media platforms, and B2B/B2C marketplace platforms to identify trends/patterns, correlations, and suspect high-value targets.
Analyze and identify core online pharmacy networks that may operate thousands of illegal online pharmacies
Produce quality and innovative intelligence and analytical reports
Evaluate, collate and develop all data, information and intelligence
Prepare and deliver clear, succinct reports and data visualizations to effectively and concisely communicate trends and targets and to guide decision-making for the Product Protection team.
Manage and develop tools for intelligence or analytical reports.
Support team with process automation initiatives.
Skills:
The ideal candidate must have a high degree of analytical ability, organization, resourcefulness, and critical thinking skills.
Fundamental understanding of methods and techniques used in researching, compiling, sorting, evaluating and analyzing pharmaceutical crimes.
Knowledge of Open-Source investigative and hunting tools (OSINT).

Perchwell is growing our team to build the workflow data platform for all residential real estate, a $4T industry (roughly 17% of US GDP) impacting the lives of every single American. As a complete market intelligence, search, and collaboration solution, we partner with forward-thinking MLS (multiple listing service) organizations and brokerages to drive the industry forward.
As a team, we have diverse backgrounds, interests and lifestyles, but we are united by our values. We do exceptional work, pay attention to the details, build great products, and have a positive impact on the industry we serve.
What we're looking for
Perchwell is rapidly expanding across the US to new MLS clients with both unique data sources that must be integrated into our data layer and sophisticated analytics requirements. Robust data management and analytics capabilities are therefore key to our future success. We are looking for a senior data analyst to propel our data integration strategies forward, establish and maintain data quality KPIs at scale, and lead a team of junior analysts to meet our customers' needs.
What you'll do
Work cross functionally to complete MLS implementations into our data layer
Collaborate with Perchwell's product and engineering teams to:
Assist in delivering data pipelines across multiple data sources as we continue to launch into new markets
Design and build the tools you'll use to manage new data KPIs
Cultivate real estate data expertise within your team and across the organization
Develop and maintain data quality KPIs with your team to guarantee gold-standard real estate datasets for our customers
Discover, qualify, evaluate, and recommend new data sources to enrich existing datasets
Participate in and help direct the growth of the Data & Analytics team
Required for the role
4+ years of experience in data analytics, including at least 2 years of experience as a senior analyst (preferably leading junior analysts on projects)
Ability to communicate insights to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong SQL & Python skills
Previous experience in an AWS environment utilizing the breadth of tools available
Must be available to work in Perchwell's NYC office
Bonus points for the following
Knowledge of or exposure to real estate-specific datasets
Previous experience leading a team of junior analysts through project completion
Salary Range:

$80K - $175K per year

Job_Title: Analyst and Senior Analyst, Data Analysis
Job_Description:
Overview
Who we are
Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.
Who we are
An important part of the Toyota family is Toyota Financial Services (TFS), the finance and insurance brand for Toyota and Lexus in North America. While TFS is a separate business entity, it is an essential part of this world-changing company – delivering on Toyota’s vision to move people beyond what’s possible. At TFS, you will help create best-in-class customer experiences in an innovative, collaborative environment.
To save time applying, Toyota does not offer sponsorship of job applicants for employment-based visas or any other work authorization for this position at this time.
Who we’re looking for
Toyota Financial Services is looking for highly motivated people to fill multiple openings as an Analyst or Senior Analyst, Data Analysis (depending on experience) whose primary focus is to generate actionable insights by analyzing data and use effective data storytelling to help our company make better data-driven decisions. These positions will report to a Manager, Data Analysis. The successful candidate will have strong written and verbal communication skills, and a proven ability to collaborate and interact with cross-functional teams and all levels of the organization.
What you’ll be doing
Uncovering business needs and the true questions that the company is trying to answer in order to properly frame your analysis.
Using Python and SQL to get the data needed into the form necessary for your analysis.
Applying your arsenal of creative problem-solving and quantitative analytical skills, including statistical methods, to connect the dots and find the insight buried in the data.
Assessing the quantitative and qualitative impacts of possible actions based on your insight, taking into consideration our customers, our employees, and our company.
Recommending actions based on your insights by effectively telling the story that is supported by data through presentations (PowerPoint), data visualizations (Tableau), and clear and concise verbal and written communication skills.
Coordinating with various stakeholders to help implement recommended actions.
Building relationships with key stakeholders across Toyota such as Sales, Marketing, Servicing, Insurance, Technology, Legal/Compliance, Finance, Treasury, etc.
Building your analytical, technical, communication, and people skills through offered training and on-the-job experience to prepare for advancement into analytical leadership roles.
Becoming a subject matter expert for the various business areas and their strategies, processes, policies, etc. to have a holistic understanding of the business and how it’s reflected in the data we capture.
Guiding/mentoring other analysts on best practices for analysis and data storytelling.
Organically finding insights through data exploration and business knowledge even without stakeholders explicitly asking for it.
What you bring
Python and/or SQL programming proficiency.
Strong creative and quantitative problem-solving skills.
Intellectual curiosity – always making an effort to understand and find the truth in the data.
Basic statistics knowledge.
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Engineering, or a closely related discipline.
What we’ll bring
During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include:
A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect.
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement.
Vehicle purchase and lease programs.
Comprehensive health care and wellness plans for your entire family.
Flextime work options based on business needs.
Toyota 401(k) Savings Plan featuring a company match, as well as an annual retirement contribution from Toyota regardless of whether you contribute.
Paid holidays and paid time off.
Referral services related to prenatal services, adoption, childcare, schools, and more.
Tax Advantaged Accounts (Health Savings Account, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA).
Relocation assistance (if applicable).
Belonging at Toyota
Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. Respect for all is our North Star. Toyota is proud to have 10+ different Business Partnering Groups across 100 different North American chapter locations that support team members’ efforts to dream, do and grow without questioning that they belong. As a company that has been one of DiversityInc’s Top 50 Companies for Diversity and a member of The Billion Dollar Roundtable supporting minority and woman-owned suppliers for over 10 years, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business.

Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
Have a question or need assistance with your application? Please send an email to talent.acquisition@toyota.com.

Junior Business Analyst- Full time remote
Description:
The Junior Business Analyst’s role is to analyze business processes and end user activities and determine the appropriate standard business practice to be used or to develop functional specifications for the development of a new practice when necessary. The Junior Analyst must be familiar with company business systems as well as industry standard business practices and be able to work with end user communities to identify core activities in existing processes.
Responsibilities:
Analyze and document existing business practices.
Define standard business processes and solutions.
Develops functional specifications and system design specifications for client engagements.
Understands the business issues and data challenges of end user's organization.
Identifies organization's strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement.
Reviews and edits requirements, specifications, business processes and recommendations related to
proposed solution.
Leads testing efforts, providing guidance and supervision to end users to ensure adequate and thorough testing.
Works with division personnel to identify required changes.
Communicates needed changes to development team.
Assists in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.
Qualifications:
May require a bachelor's degree in a related area and 2+ years of experience in the field or in a related area.
Experience with MS Access databases, creating and maintaining, is a bonus.
Thorough knowledge of business processes and computerized business applications, especially Oracle Applications.
Ability to analyze business situations and problems.
Must have excellent communications and interpersonal skills.
Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs.
A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.

Distinguishing Features of the Class:
This work involves the analysis and management of information regarding the frequency and distribution of diseases and injuries within human populations and environments. The Epidemiologist – Data Analyst will design, create and maintain databases and data systems, pinpoint trends and patterns and identify new opportunities for process improvement. The employee acts as a consultant to the staff of the Health Department in programs relating to chronic disease, injury prevention, bio-terrorist threats and disease outbreaks and patterns in a community. Does related work as required.
Typical Work Activities:
Collects data, coordinates statistical analysis of data and assists with evaluation and interpretation of findings to detect trends and significant findings;
Conducts surveillance activities to identify and monitor disease and disability trends;
Serves as resource and technical consultant on disease and disability patterns;
Assists in timely and accurate reporting of public health data;
Interprets and evaluates results of studies, assesses risks of disease and/or environmental hazards, provides information and makes recommendations to others regarding disease or disability patterns;
Designs, conducts and evaluates community studies inclusive of data collection required for assessing general health conditions in the community;
Develops and presents applicable educational material to staff, health care professionals and the public;
Participates in a variety of meetings, committees, study groups and task forces in the community;
Prepares correspondence and reports, including technical papers and assists in the development and preparation of project proposals for funding;
Acts as liaison between the community, federal, state and other agencies and department personnel;
Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with health professionals in the community and representatives of other agencies.
Full Performance Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Personal Characteristics:
Thorough knowledge of the principles, standard practices, methods, techniques and recent developments in the field of data management, analysis, and visualization;
Strong communication skills both written and oral, computer skills and statistical analysis skills;
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with the public;
Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the position.
Minimum Qualifications (either):
A. Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university with a Master’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Public Health or other closely related health science with a concentration in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Computer Science or other closely related field; OR,
B. Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Public Health or other closely related health science and two (2) years of experience in informatics or computer science; OR,
C. Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university with a Bachelor’s degree and four (4) years of experience in informatics or computer science.
Note:
Incumbents in this position must be willing to be immunized for diseases as necessary and appropriate and be available by pager, during business hours and after hours, to respond, as necessary, to notifications of public health emergencies.
Albany County is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
All Albany County Department of Health employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19.
About Albany County
Albany County is a unique blend of rural, urban and suburban communities. It’s the ideal place to live, work and raise a family as we offer competitive salaries, a generous benefits package, and plenty of chances to explore your professional career.
Our employment opportunities are wide ranging with departments that include those offering direct programs and services to our constituents such as the Department for Aging, Department for Children, Youth and Families and Departments of Health and Mental Health as well as those departments which offer support like General Services, Human Resources and Information Services.
The Veterans Service Bureau, Crime Victim and Sexual Violence Center and Department of Social Services workforce also provide important services to our residents and those who travel through Albany County each day.
With 19 municipalities, our villages, towns and cities will impress you with their beauty, food, lodging, shopping, and ample entertainment. Whether you hike our trails, bike on our paths, visit our parks and museums, fish in our streams and brooks, or change your career path, you’ll find it all here.
The Albany County Department of Health (ACDOH) strives to protect and improve the health of individuals, families, and communities, utilizing strategies that reduce health disparities and promote health equity.
We collaborate with community partners and offer a variety of high quality programs and services to accomplish the following:
Prevent communicable and chronic diseases, injuries, and disabilities;
Protect against environmental hazards that threaten health and safety;
Promote the health and wellness of our citizens and our communities; and,
Prepare for and respond to public health emergencies.

Job_Title: Data Transformation Analyst II/Customer Support Associate
Job_Description:
Job Description:
Your role
Are you an analytical thinker with a high level of attention to detail? Do you enjoy problem solving, data research, and helping customers with complex business solutions?
We’re looking for a Data Transformation Analyst/Customer Support Associate within the OPIS Retail Fuels Division. In this hybrid role, you will:
Maintain the data quality for retail fuels pricing, station, and amenities data across North America and Australia, eventually expanding globally.
Run quality control processes to correct or eliminate incorrect or invalid data points according to OPIS methodology.
Assist the retail business development and product development teams in data reliability goals.
Provide sales support by creating historical data files, setting prospective clients up on trials of our services, and answering questions regarding data methodology and data quality.
Continue the OPIS legacy of providing the highest-quality customer support in the industry.
Your team
We’re OPIS, a Dow Jones company. In this role, you will be joining the OPIS Retail Data Quality Team primarily located in the United States, with remote workers globally. This team of 10 direct colleagues and many secondary colleagues is part of a high-growth division that manages the quality of retail fuel pricing and station data. OPIS Retail team members work with fuel retailers and convenience store operators to provide data and analytics that help them optimize their business operations and run more profitably and efficiently.
You’ll also work with other industries that utilize OPIS data, such as connected cars and mobile app/web clients who display OPIS real-time retail fuel prices and station information directly to consumers. And in a world where the reliance on fossil fuels is slowly diminishing as we look for cleaner and more sustainable energy options, OPIS is diversifying and future-proofing our business by expanding into clean energy, alternative fuels, and data and analytics for electric vehicles, while still providing world class data and products for the energy that moves us today.
Your expertise
You have
A bachelor’s degree. Business, Data Analytics, and Mathematics degrees are a strong fit for this role.
Prior experience with data management and/or customer service.
Fluency in English, both written and oral, with other language skills desirable based on our global customer base.
Knowledge in data visualization/analytics tools such as Power BI or Tableu and a fluency in all MS Office applications, with advanced Excel expertise a priority. Proficiency in SQL Server Management Studio, R, or Python is a plus, but not required.
You are
Organized with strong problem-solving skills, including the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
A self-motivated individual who is able to work effectively and collaboratively with all co-workers, while also completing projects independently.
Strong with data analytics, able to transform and analyze data to find insights and to create solutions that help automate improvements in our data quality.
Driven by the desire to help others succeed, delivering the highest levels of customer service and professionalism.
Working Hours
9:30am – 6:30pm Eastern Time (UTC -5)

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.
This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

Position Description:
The Data Analyst, R&D IT BIA will be part of a team committed to identifying and implementing technology solutions that supports R&D Business Insight & Analytics business organization. In this role, the Data Analyst will learn and demonstrate key skills including process definition and mapping, requirements elicitation and documentation, user acceptance testing, defining, and measuring business value, and technology solution identification. This will be achieved by:
Understanding and evaluating current business processes and identifying areas of improvement.
Acquiring a deep understanding of existing systems/platforms currently enabling clinical trial execution.
Capturing business needs and researching new IT advancements as potential solutions to business needs.
Presenting ideas and observations in meetings.
Collaborating with end users and stakeholders across IT and Business functions.
Contributing a steady stream of creative, out-of-the-box thinking in support of innovation and problem solving.
Key Responsibilities:
Work in close partnership with Business Insights and Analytics (BI&A) and R&D IT product teams
Help manage product backlog, determine priority by interviewing business owner(s) and determine the release schedule based on business value and impact
Help manage the product backlog partnering with product and business team by understanding of customer needs, translate requirements into user stories & acceptance criteria
Create IT documentation artifacts in support of an agile technology implementation model, including but not limited to requirements specifications, process diagrams, user acceptance test plans, traceability matrices, and wireframes.
Establishes and develops effective business relationships with IT and Business domain stakeholders to ensure IT can deliver solutions which align with business strategies and divisional priorities.
Develop strong understanding of existing technologies and business capabilities within the assigned Product Line.
Ability to work with technical leads to put together the architecture that supports optimal design of IT product
Be responsible for day-to-day operation of IT applications in scope, ensuring IT partners can maintain acceptable SLA
Triage any production issues, understand the business impact, and assign necessary resources to address them in a timely manner
Have some experience in of one or more areas: data modeling, data architecture, frontend development, database design, API development, or process modeling
Qualifications & Experience:
2+ years of directly relevant experience
Makes basic decisions requiring limited judgment and using established procedures and methodologies. Work is done under close supervision
Responsible for supporting functional team members and performing basic tasks with some oversight
Collaborates and works with stakeholders to meet requests.
Explains own work clearly and explains any independent judgement well.
Understanding of functional business context and how their work may apply
Demonstrates openness to learning and developing. Takes a responsibility for their own development and growth.
Ability to think creatively about where business initiatives drive technology evolution and to break-down processes and reimagine enabling technology capabilities with stakeholders
Experience with Agile methodology and understanding of the Software Development Lifecycle Management model and documentation
Experience with one or more technologies:
UI Development using HTML/CSS/JavaScript and Angular
SOA / API based software development using Java (version 11 and up), Spring Boot, Microservices, REST, JSON
Wireframe development
Visualization and modeling tool e.g., Tableau, Spotfire, MicroStrategy, Phyton, R-Studio, etc.

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire
Salary: $80 - $115k/yr
Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.
Ideal Skills & Requirements:
· Proficiency working with HRIS, databases and reporting applications
· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
· Ability to work extended hours as necessary to fulfill time sensitive responsibilities
· Commitment to the office and firm

You will leverage a variety of analytic methods, tools, visualizations, and modeling techniques to deliver insights to business units. This is a great opportunity to partner with business units, stakeholders, and leadership to deep dive into processes and recommend data driven solutions while enhancing your modern cloud-native tool experience to help develop your career.

Company: California Department of Housing and Community Development
Job_Description:
Job Duties
Under close supervision of the Staff Services Manager I of the Contracts Office, the Staff Services Analyst (SSA) analyzes and coordinates the development of contracts for the department. The SSA aids with oversight, evaluation and technical support and process a range of different types of contracts including, interagency, Local Assistance, and service.
Desirables
Knowledge of State Contracting Manual and State Administrative Manual
Knowledge of the principles of sustainability
Detail Oriented
Self-motivated with a degree of independence
Strong writing and analytical skills
Ability to organize and establish simultaneous workload priorities
Ability to work well as a part of a team
Proficient use of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
Promotes a respectful and cooperative work environment
Demonstrates strong ability as an active listener
Excellent customer service skills
Essential Functions
Analyze and process new, draft, final, and amendment to the less complex contract agreement packages including various contract forms, law and policy citation exhibits, contractor instructional attachments, award documentation, and other material needed for determining legal sufficiency and policy compliance. Review items that appear incomplete, inadequate, and fail to substantially comply with contract policies and return materials to Department staff with constructive correction instructions. Assist Department staff in the development, completion or correction of contract forms and exhibits and respond to Draft and Final contract status inquiries while working closely with unit manager on related issues and workload progress.
Review, evaluate, and process service contracts ensuring that the purpose, terms and conditions, funding authority and data conform, align with the requirement of State and Federal contract laws, respectively. This includes decisions on the appropriate bidding method, contract solicitation, inputting applicable bids and registering contracts into Cal eProcure portal in compliance with Fi$Cal requirements per California Government Code Section 15849.22 (b) (1). Research, interpret, develop, and communicate contract laws, regulations, policies, and procedures appearing in various resources including the California Government Code, California Code of Regulations, Public Contract Code, State Administrative Manual, State Contracting Manual, and applicable Executive Orders and Management Memos. Assist with consultations to Department management and staff by providing technical expertise and training in areas of service contracts.
Analyze the less complex HCD 619's Purchase Requisitions, solicit requests for quotes in writing from vendors; analyze data to determine which supplier is able to meet all business and delivery requirements; create purchase orders, conduct peer reviews to ensure purchases are compliant and in accordance with HCD and State purchasing policies, procedures and sound business practices. Coordinate with other applicable Administrative staff and internal resources (i.e. Accounting, Budget Office, etc.) to obtain assistance or resolve concerns. Assist in trouble shooting problem contracts returned unapproved by the Department of General Services (DGS) and coordinate needed corrections with Department staff. Prepare rebuttals and responses to DGS contract return notices.
Maintain contract analyst workload spreadsheet logs and required entries to Fi$Cal and the Department database, Consolidated Automated Program Enterprise System (CAPES). Conduct necessary research to follow-up on contracts that become stalled in the development or approval process. Research and gather information to complete special projects related to contracts as assigned.
Provide back up to other contract/procurement analysts; work on special assignments on an as-needed basis. Perform other duties as assigned
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $3,534.00 - $5,744.00 per month
Benefits:
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote

Description
We are seeking a self-motivated Data Analyst to provide technical and analytic support to a small, high-impact team. This is a developmental position with opportunities for career growth along a Data Science track. The position requires an active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance.
The Data Analyst will be expected to work with Data Scientists to build statistical models, test hypotheses, and interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report data findings. The Analyst may be required to leverage automation and machine learning models to manage data, predict scenarios, and make recommendations to a non-technical audience. The Analyst may be required to produce Finished Intelligence reports and serve as a bridge between Intelligence Analysts and Data Scientists.
The Data Analyst will contribute to building new analytical tools in support of the IC customer and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment. The Data Analyst will be expected to learn and leverage technical frameworks and collaboration technologies, including Amazon Web Service (AWS) and Git.
Requirements:
Experience with scripting in Python or R
Experience (either on-the-job or in an academic setting) working with data manipulation techniques and statistics
Experience producing Finished Intelligence products for IC customers
Knowledge of computer science concepts, data architecture, and common statistical models
Knowledge of all-source intelligence, including SIGINT, and/or HUMINT collection reports
Familiarity with cable writing styles and classified client databases, including specific targeting tools
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences
Familiarity with key US foreign policy and national security Counterterrorism (CT) objectives
Knowledge of IC policies and procedures
Ability to work efficiently in a metrics-driven environment
TS/SCI clearance with polygraph required
BS and 4 – 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 – 6 years of prior relevant experience.
Pay Range:
Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

We’re a recognized Elite Agency award winner and a leading property and casualty broker, benefits consultant, wealth manager, and retirement plan advisor. NFP provides solutions enabling client success through the expertise of over 7,000 global employees, investments in innovative technologies, and enduring relationships with highly rated insurers, vendors and financial institutions. To learn more, please visit: https://www.NFP.com.
Summary of Role:

Provides technical support during and after implementation for healthcare electronic data interchange applications.
Responsible for processes including imports/exports, data file creation and testing with stakeholders, and
reconciliation to ensure accurate eligibility and billing records both internally and at carriers. Utilizes Excel at an
expert level, as well as various information systems, databases and technology tools related to assigned areas.
Initiates appropriate and necessary communication with management, carriers, clients, brokers and vendors.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Follow procedures to resolve data discrepancies with clients and vendors weekly.
Requires excellent follow-up and written and oral communication skills, and a focus on the customer experience.
Perform data review and import/export activities of varying degrees of complexity for new client
implementations and established client renewals and changes.
Efficiently complete tasks including, but not limited to, comparing data from multiple sources using Excel and other data formats, performing imports or exports to or from PPI and vendor systems, and reconciliation to ensure accurate records.
Support trading partners’ file delivery through established FTP and SFTP procedures, or alternatives as required.
Troubleshoot in a collaborative way to ensure client data can be received successfully and timely.
As needed, may assist with data entry of eligibility into various systems, with a high level of accuracy and within required timeframe.
Conduct analysis of file transmissions and respond to inquiries regarding issues. May be responsible for documentation and reports.
Produce, maintain, and distribute reports, both in a production environment and on an ad hoc basis.
While performing ongoing functions identify, develop and document procedural and systematic
recommendations to improve efficiency and quality.
Provide ongoing updates to management. Seek assistance as needed.
Assist in the development of business requirements for department’s IT development projects.
May act as a technical resource and assist in staff training as requested.
Assist with additional needs as required and take on special projects, as directed.
REQUIREMENTS:
Provide prompt, courteous and excellent service at an acceptable cost to all customers and operate in accordance with State and Federal law, the company’s Statement of Business
Practices, Affirmative Action, Diversity and other standards.
Actively cooperate and interact with all entities of NFP.

1-3 years of work experience preferred.

The Mission:
At Enigma, we believe that the future of the small business economy runs on data. Enigma provides the most comprehensive data about the identity and financial health of nearly every small business in the United States. Our customers - some of the largest financial services, fintechs, and insurance companies - use our unique product to make smarter credit-related decisions and to better serve their small business customers.
We are looking for a Product Analyst to join our growing team. You will play a central role in exploring our small business data asset for insights, investigating new sources of data and developing quantitative benchmarks for our product.
The Role:
As a Product Analyst, you will work closely with Product, Sales, Customer Success, and Data Science teams and use your data analysis abilities to showcase the power of our small and medium businesses data as part of our marketing outreach efforts, sales conversations, customer pilot projects and collaborations with data scientists. You will also collaborate with our Engineering and Data Science teams to support product development.
We stand by the power of our data and you will create impact by helping us demonstrate it to external stakeholders. The ideal candidate is motivated by seeking out the business value of data and gaining experience in product development and go-to-market efforts, looking deeply into the specifics of data and checking it against real-world values, and distilling problems down to the simplest solvable core.
We are looking for someone who will:
Own and lead data analysis projects to generate the insights that drive our product forward
Act as the vanguard of product and DS research by understanding requirements and prototyping paths to achieving those requirements, including learning cutting edge techniques in machine learning where applicable
Tell data-driven stories to be published on the Enigma blog and various news outlets
Present analyses to and engage with customers alongside Sales and Customer Success teams
Conduct analyses that demonstrate the full power of our data for an external audience
Evaluate and research the value of new data sources
Create notebooks and processes for non-technical members to perform analyses themselves
Gain experience and train in developing tools and reports using best-in-class tech stack and infrastructure
Make an impact on Enigma's growth from day one
What makes this job interesting?
Impact: you will be at the core of Enigma's growth engine, providing value to customers and translating that to product
Challenge: this role is expected to be intellectually stimulating and rewarding for someone motivated by engaging deeply with data and product
Growth: you will be situated at the cutting edge of data science and product at Enigma and there will be many mentorship opportunities in this role
Our ideal candidate will:
Have strong analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to extract, manipulate and analyze data
Bring strong business intuition to make sense of complex business data
Have proficiency in one or two data wrangling tools for tabular data, at least some familiarity with SQL
Possess attention to detail and the ability to gather requirements, plan analysis and manage a project end-to-end
Bring empathy to see things through the eyes of multiple stakeholders, such as prospective customers, journalists, small business owners as well as technical and non-technical colleagues to create outputs addressing their needs
Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills to translate data analysis for non-technical audiences
Be curious, coachable, reliable, and driven for growth
Bonus points if you:
Bring experience in a consulting, project/product management, or data analyst role is ideal, but we're prepared to invest in training in both technical skills and go-to-market abilities
About Us:
At Enigma, we're building the single, most reliable source of data on businesses to power the future of financial services. By engineering better data from hundreds of public and third-party sources, we aim to tell the complete story of every business, so that companies of every size can access the financial services they need to grow and thrive. Our core values - generosity, curiosity, ingenuity, & drive - guide everything we do from how we make our most important product decisions to how we work with and support one another on a daily basis. We're a team of curious, driven individuals with diverse backgrounds and skills, but we're all passionate about engineering deeper understanding through data—together. If this resonates, we would love to hear from you!
We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace and an affirmative-action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
Salary Range: $80,000-$150,000
A note on salary ranges: we pride ourselves on paying competitively for our size and industry. Salary is one piece of a total Enigma compensation package that includes additional benefits and opportunities. All of our compensation packages include equity because we believe 100% of Enigma employees should have the option to purchase ownership in the company and benefit from the value we're creating together.

Company Overview
Riverstone Logistics (RLX) is committed to being an honest, reliable, dependable freight forwarding partner. Every day we are focused on fulfilling our Purpose of Delivering Life's Best Memories.
RLX provides final mile deliveries through dedicated and network models for various clients. We love working with new clients that are looking to enhance their customer experience through final mile deliveries.
Headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina, RLX has currently over 400 employees and is always looking for new employees that demonstrate leadership capabilities and exceptional communication skills to grow with us at our home office as well as client sites across the United States.

Job Summary
As a Business Analyst, you will analyze past and projected market trends and their impacts on RLX, support the corporate team with long-term and short-term projects, and identify creative solutions to generate revenue and increase efficiencies. You will use analytical skills, market trends, and the success of competitors to assist with the development and application of various pricing strategies.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Generate new business insights and provide support to management for decision-making.
Identify areas for improvement and generate strategies to implement them.
Analyze large amounts of information to develop innovative solutions.
Organize large amounts of complex data quickly and effectively.
Participate in the growth of the company and streamlining of processes.
Collaborate with various departments and other branch locations.
Track performance at various levels to mine company data.
Communicate effectively to all levels of the organization.
Maintain up-to-date awareness of company activities, industry trends, and government regulations.
Completes required training.
Perform other related duties assigned.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to remain stationary for long periods of time and to communicate effectively with coworkers and outside stakeholders in person, on the telephone and via email and other computer-related messaging. The employee is occasionally required to maneuver about the work areas and manipulate various objects. Occasionally the employee will be expected to move boxes, and manipulate objects in various directions. This position may require extended work hours and travel.

Riverstone Logistics is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug Free workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Riverstone Logistics also complies with the Immigration Reform & Control Act and E-Verify, so we ask that you bring the appropriate documents to confirm your authorization to work in the United States with you upon request.
