Job_Title: Senior Business Analyst (Remote - IL, IN, MI, OH)
Job_Description:
Position Goals:
The Senior Value Management Analyst’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of project stakeholders, whether they are customers or end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders, gathering, and compiling user requirements to convey to development teams throughout the software lifecycle.
Their chief focus is on the human interaction points, what the users and system are doing (inputs, transformation, outputs) and the system capabilities. Making sure all the processes and activities within the environment, maps them and analyzes their effectiveness and necessity.
The Senior Value Management Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Value Management Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT's understanding of business requirements.
As our operating model matures, so does this role on my team. It's an exciting place to work right now and I'm proud to be a part of it. If you like working in a collaborative, team-based environment where we work to make positive, lasting improvements for our customers, we want to hear from you!
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Carry a deep understanding of the lines of business (e.g., consumer banking) and how business objectives translate and impact technology environments.
Understand key business objectives, outcomes, and measurement approaches. Engage with Business Stakeholder, IT, and Service Owners to define, design, and mature business value metrics for their corresponding domains.
Assist with Training and Basic Change Management Concepts.
Collaborate with project managers and project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Fully understanding the business needs: E.g., drivers for change, current pain points, vision, internal and external factors.
Incorporate end-user feedback from User Experience (UX) and Research & Analytics (CX) to define scope and impact to business objectives.
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to write requirements specifications accurately and concisely.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to IT partners and developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Assist with User Acceptance Testing Activities.
Position Requirements:
Education:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Experience:
A minimum of five (5) years of business analyst related experience.
A minimum of three (3) years’ experience focused in banking or finance.
Preferred Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business, management, or related field
Certified BA
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Mintel Comperemedia is the premier source of direct marketing competitive intelligence in the US & Canada. We monitor direct mail and email advertising and provide insight into acquisition and loyalty strategies, giving clients the intelligence they need to compete more effectively.
We are looking for a Data Quality Analyst to join the team and maintain the integrity of our structured data.
This role is based in Chicago and requires the individual to work a hybrid schedule of 2 days in-office and 3 days remote weekly.
What You Will Be Doing:
Proactively investigate potential data quality issues, provide solutions and implement solutions to improve quality
Monitor the quality of data received from vendors and deliver the appropriate feedback to the vendor as necessary
Manage the data quality feedback loop so that all issues are corrected at the source in a timely manner and all stakeholders are aware of any issues
Analyze issues and provide the vendors with feedback for all issues
Ensure that all aspects of the data correction are occurring and data quality is improving
Complete various audits and analyze findings across multiple data sets
Work with the QC team to complete audits of the various Comperemedia sectors, analyze findings and identify next steps for improvement
Monitor Quality Control ticketing queues by raising data quality tickets, adding appropriate information to open tickets, and resolving any methodology questions addressed in tickets
Work with the Product Development team and the QA manager to roll out new information to the vendors and the Mintel quality control team
Effectively document all data changes and updates and train various teams on any quality issues or discrepancies that arise
Who We Are Looking For:
While we may have a wish list, we are always open to looking at different profiles for our roles, so please don't hesitate in applying even if your experience does not check all of the boxes. We believe there is no one perfect resume for a role, but there is a perfect candidate for us, and that could be you.
Self-Directed: You take initiative to solve problems and uncover opportunities, and you are eager to take ownership and accountability for the growth of our products.
Great Communicator: You know how to communicate information across various business lines, adjusting your language to reach technical and non-technical audiences alike.
Tech-Savvy: You have excellent Microsoft Office skills and are comfortable with the Google suite of products. You have familiarity with marketing email communication platforms, and can adapt to learning new tools and platforms as the business evolves.
A Collaborator: You bring an energy to the table that encourages and develops internal relationships. You seek out opportunities to partner with peers in your department and across the organization.
Passionate: You are a positive influence on your teams, and you have the energy, intellect, and humility that draws people to wanting to learn more from you.

Description
We are seeking a self-motivated Data Analyst to provide technical and analytic support to a small, high-impact team. This is a developmental position with opportunities for career growth along a Data Science track. The position requires an active TS/SCI with Polygraph security clearance.
The Data Analyst will be expected to work with Data Scientists to build statistical models, test hypotheses, and interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report data findings. The Analyst may be required to leverage automation and machine learning models to manage data, predict scenarios, and make recommendations to a non-technical audience. The Analyst may be required to produce Finished Intelligence reports and serve as a bridge between Intelligence Analysts and Data Scientists.
The Data Analyst will contribute to building new analytical tools in support of the IC customer and will be expected to collaborate with team members in a highly technical environment. The Data Analyst will be expected to learn and leverage technical frameworks and collaboration technologies, including Amazon Web Service (AWS) and Git.
Requirements:
Experience with scripting in Python or R
Experience (either on-the-job or in an academic setting) working with data manipulation techniques and statistics
Experience producing Finished Intelligence products for IC customers
Knowledge of computer science concepts, data architecture, and common statistical models
Knowledge of all-source intelligence, including SIGINT, and/or HUMINT collection reports
Familiarity with cable writing styles and classified client databases, including specific targeting tools
Ability to communicate technical findings to non-technical audiences
Familiarity with key US foreign policy and national security Counterterrorism (CT) objectives
Knowledge of IC policies and procedures
Ability to work efficiently in a metrics-driven environment
TS/SCI clearance with polygraph required
BS and 4 – 8 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 2 – 6 years of prior relevant experience.

Pay Range $78,000.00 - $120,000.00 - $162,000.00
The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Is an expert at translating data into actionable insights.

A career at Auto-Owners is challenging and rewarding. Our group of caring associates create financial security by helping individuals and businesses make a new start when a loss occurs.
Job Description
We offer a merit-based work-from-home program based on job responsibilities. After initial training in-person, this specific role could have the flexibility to only be required in the office 1 day per month.
Auto-Owners Insurance, a top-rated insurance carrier, is seeking a motivated entry-level Data Analyst to join our team. The position is responsible for creating pricing plans to help us accomplish our growth and profitability objectives and requires the person to:
Analyze new and existing data to assure high quality. Resolve data issues by working internally across divisions and externally with statistical agents.
Evaluate and submit reoccurring statutory reporting, verification & payment of assessments, and ad-hoc data calls.
Organize and provide management with reports to aid in decision making.
Effectively communicate with other employees through verbal and written means.
Participate in both formal and informal training sessions.
Desired Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or another related technical field is required.
High aptitude for mathematics and actuarial sciences
Actuarial exams are considered but not required
Experience with Microsoft SQL, R or other programming/database/statistical languages
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Above average communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to adapt to constant change and innovation
Benefits
Auto-Owners offers a wide range of career opportunities, and we are seeking talent that will help us continue our long tradition of success. We offer a friendly work environment, structured training program, employee mentoring and an excellent compensation/benefits package. Along with a competitive base salary, matched 401(k), fully-funded pension plan (once vested), and bonus programs, Auto-Owners also provides generous paid time off including holidays, vacation days, personal time, and sick leave. If you're looking to do rewarding work alongside great people, Auto-Owners is the place for you!
Equal Employment Opportunity
Auto-Owners Insurance is an equal opportunity employer. The Company hires, transfers, and promotes on the basis of ability, without consideration of disability, age, sex, race, color, religion, height, weight, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, or any factor contrary to federal, state or local law.
Please note that the ability to work in the U.S. without current or future sponsorship is a requirement.

Analysts analyze data and document their results and recommendations in order to solve problems, provide information needed to make business decisions and make recommendations for continuous improvement. Incumbents develop, administer and enhance tools and systems that manage Company information. Analysts typically prepare for their role by either achieving a post-secondary degree in a specific field, obtaining certification, or by on-the-job training and work experience. Incumbents may directly manage a small number of direct reports; the primary function of the role is applying analytical knowledge and skills as an exempt-level individual contributor.
What Will You Be Doing

Research, analyze, maintain, modify, validate and prepare data, information and content used in making business decisions.
Output is used for forecasting, costing, planning, positioning, trending, measuring, controlling risk, contracting and administration.
Run automated excel/SQL reports.

Coordinate, produce, and distribute business documents such as reports, system and process documentation, etc.
Support, participate in, or lead smaller components of projects. Carry out tasks and activities that support project plans and deliverables.
May participate in department/divisional workgroups and initiatives.

Position: HR Technology Business Analyst
Location: Washington, DC
Industry: Law firm/Legal/Professional Services
Duration: Direct Hire
Salary: $80 - $115k/yr
Summary: Under the general direction and supervision of the HRIS Manager and Director of Human Resources, and following prescribed department, office and firm procedures, the HR Technology Business Analyst is responsible for the daily support of the firm’s various human resources systems, including performance, maintenance, information security, testing updates and improving process efficiency, HR data reporting, and HR applications support. The HR Technology Business Analyst is expected to perform all responsibilities with a commitment to providing superior service to the firm’s lawyers and staff, efficient and effective departmental operations, and an atmosphere of teamwork and continuous improvement. Above all, the HR Technology Business Analyst must fulfill the needs of the office in a manner which is consistent with the Firm’s Core Values.
Duties & Responsibilities:
· Act as a primary technical support analyst for HR systems and serve as project lead for all HRIS system projects and initiatives
· Provide functional and technical support, identify and troubleshoot system problems. Ensure data integrity, testing of system changes, report writing and process improvement opportunities
· Manage system access to ensure appropriate security procedures are in place, perform data audits
· Develop, implement and maintain, user procedures, guidelines and business processes documentation
· Perform analysis of HR functionality, recommend and develop process/customer service improvements and system enhancements to optimize the HR systems value
· Lead projects and relationships with IT, Finance, HR managers, HR vendors, Benefits vendors and other subject matter experts to ensure the services and solutions provided meet the needs of our customers
· Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing system upgrades or enhancements
· Maintain awareness of current trends in HR technology and understand statutory and regulatory requirements affecting HR, Benefits, Recruitment and Payroll systems
· Responsibilities include evaluating project needs, creating detailed plans based on needs for the project, performing detailed business analysis, documenting business and functional requirements, and resolving project issues
· Develops detailed checklist and project plan incorporating both technical, operations, and business tasks as required
· Provides regular reporting of project status to leadership and key stakeholders
· Identifies areas of potential concern in sufficient time to mitigate risk
· Assists the project workgroup in managing those risks throughout the project by communicating, tracking and mitigating issues
· Analyze and diagnose the root cause of project / system issues of varying complexity and either solve it or pass it to the responsible resources, internally or externally, for remediation
· Serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams, documenting project requirements that successfully implement projects
· Responsible for creating, and developing project charters, business cases, technical and architecture specifications and project plans for identified projects, as directed by the enterprise project management office
· Responsible for completeness of project documentation throughout the project lifecycle and for coordinating with leadership to receive appropriate approvals at each phase of the project
· Leverage analytical skills to distill large volumes of data into clear, concise action plans aimed at improving the delivery of projects/initiatives
· Maintains current knowledge of privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR and ensures data is protected.
Ideal Skills & Requirements:
· Proficiency working with HRIS, databases and reporting applications
· Advanced written and verbal communication skills with attention to detail and ability to communicate with non-technical and technical personnel
· Requires excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated understanding of the concepts and issues unique to the management of HR data.
· Confidentiality, discretion and tact
· Aptitude and willingness to work with complex procedures
· Ability to manage multiple priorities and adjust to changing priorities and deadlines in a professional manner
· Ability to exercise initiative, independent judgment and common sense
· Strong service orientation, and an ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with system users, peers, office and firm management, and outside business partners
· Ability to work well under pressure, facilitate solutions, and meet deadlines and milestones for projects assigned
· Ability to work extended hours as necessary to fulfill time sensitive responsibilities
· Commitment to the office and firm
